original: de'i don snang ba can 'di ni //üîΩtshad yin 'dzin pa'i bdag yod kyang //
analyzed: de'i don snang ba can 'di ni // tshad yin 'dzin pa'i bdag yod kyang //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:üîΩThis consciousness that has the aspect of an object is valid cognition,

original: phyi rol don la ltos med de //
analyzed: phyi rol don la ltos med de //
translated: but it is not independent of external objects,

original: gzhan gyi don tsan ma yin phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don tsan ma yin phyir // zhes bya ba la /
translated: because it is not for the sake of another.

original: don gyi rnam pa can nyid kyi shes pa 'di'i phyi rol don la tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa can nyid kyi shes pa 'di'i phyi rol don la tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: This consciousness that has the aspect of an object is valid cognition in regard to external objects.

original: 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid yod kyang phyi rol gyi don la tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid yod kyang phyi rol gyi don la tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Although it has the nature of apprehending, it is not valid cognition in regard to external objects,

original: gzhan gyi don can ma yin pa ste bdag gi don can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don can ma yin pa ste bdag gi don can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not for the sake of another, it is for the sake of the self.

original: rig pa'i ngo bo nyid ni gzhan gyi don can mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rig pa'i ngo bo nyid ni gzhan gyi don can mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: The nature of awareness is not seen to be for the sake of another,

original: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin shes bya thams cad la thun mong ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin shes bya thams cad la thun mong ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of understanding is not shared by all objects of knowledge.

original: 'o na don ji ltar khong du chud par 'dra ba las 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na don ji ltar khong du chud par 'dra ba las 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well then, how does it come about that the understanding of the object is similar?üîΩBecause the self of the object

original: gang phyir ji ltar don gyi bdag / shes la gnas pa de bzhin du //
analyzed: gang phyir ji ltar don gyi bdag / shes la gnas pa de bzhin du //
translated: is just as it is present in consciousness,

original: gnas par 'di nges de ltar yang //
analyzed: gnas par 'di nges de ltar yang //
translated: it is ascertained that it is present in that way.

original: bdag nyid rig pa'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid rig pa'i phyir na'o //
translated: Because it is aware of itself.

original: don gyi bdag nyid mthong min phyir //
analyzed: don gyi bdag nyid mthong min phyir //
translated: Because the nature of the object is not seen,

original: de nyid don rig nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: de nyid don rig nyid du 'dod //
translated: That itself is asserted to be the awareness of the object.

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: This is said.

original: gang gi phyir shes pa la ji ltar sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i shes pa la bdag nyid sngon po la sogs pa 'phos nas snang bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pa la ji ltar sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i shes pa la bdag nyid sngon po la sogs pa 'phos nas snang bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Because, for example, in the case of the cognition of blue, yellow, and so on, the cognition itself appears as if it has transformed into blue and so on.

original: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pas phyi rol gyi bdag nyid nges par byed pa de bas na rnam pa nyid don du rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin la /
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pas phyi rol gyi bdag nyid nges par byed pa de bas na rnam pa nyid don du rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin la /
translated: In the same way, the external object is ascertained by the aspect of blue, yellow, and so on. Therefore the aspect itself is the reason for the realization of the object.

original: de nyid phyi rol gyi don la tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid phyi rol gyi don la tshad ma yin no //
translated: That itself is the valid knowledge of the external object.

original: de lta na 'o na ni phyi rol gyi rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni phyi rol gyi rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin na /
translated: If that is so, then if the awareness of the external object itself is the result,

original: rang rig pas ci zhig dgos she na /
analyzed: rang rig pas ci zhig dgos she na /
translated: what is the need for reflexive awareness?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gang gi phyir gzhal bya la gnas pa'i don gyi rnam pa 'di bzhin du sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis sam /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhal bya la gnas pa'i don gyi rnam pa 'di bzhin du sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis sam /
translated: Because the aspect of the object that exists in the object of comprehension is like this: the nature of blue, yellow, and so on, or the nature of a pot, cloth, and so on.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bdag rig pa las nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir don phyi rol rig pa nyid rang rig par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bdag rig pa las nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir don phyi rol rig pa nyid rang rig par 'dod do //
translated: Because of the certainty that arises from the intrinsic awareness of the nature of desire, etc., the awareness of external objects is asserted to be reflexive awareness.

original: de dag gis ni 'di skad ston te ;
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'di skad ston te ;
translated: They demonstrate the following:

original: don la rtog pa ni rang gi rnam pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: don la rtog pa ni rang gi rnam pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Since the conception of an object occurs in accordance with its aspect, reflexive awareness is the effect.

original: 'o na don mthong ba nyid mngon du yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na don mthong ba nyid mngon du yod do zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúIs the mere seeing of the object present?‚Äù

original: de ni ma yin te don gyi bdag nyid phyi rol pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te don gyi bdag nyid phyi rol pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: That is not so, because the external object, which is the nature of the object, does not exist.

original: mthong bar ma gyur na mngon sum gyi gzhal bya ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong bar ma gyur na mngon sum gyi gzhal bya ma yin te /
translated: If it does not become visible, it is not an object of direct perception.

original: mngon @128b sum gyi 'bras bu sems pa'i skabs yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon @128b sum gyi 'bras bu sems pa'i skabs yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because the context is the effect of direct perception, the mind.

original: mngon sum ni rang gi ngo bo myong ba'i phyir dang / don gzhan ma myong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum ni rang gi ngo bo myong ba'i phyir dang / don gzhan ma myong ba'i phyir /
translated: Since direct perception experiences its own nature and does not experience another object,

original: rang rig pa nyid 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid 'bras bu'o //
translated: reflexive awareness is the effect.

original: blo la gnas pa can don te //
analyzed: blo la gnas pa can don te //
translated: The object is that which is present in the mind.

original: sgrub byed yin de'i bya ba de //
analyzed: sgrub byed yin de'i bya ba de //
translated: It is the probandum, and that is its function.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to what is called

original: don rig pa'i ngo bo nyid rang rig pa de blo la gnas pa can gyi rnam pa nyid sgrub byed yin te /
analyzed: don rig pa'i ngo bo nyid rang rig pa de blo la gnas pa can gyi rnam pa nyid sgrub byed yin te /
translated: The proof of the aspect itself, which is the nature of the cognition of the object, is the self-cognition.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa de'i rang rig pa'i bya ba de ni /üîΩgang phyir ji ltar gnas don te //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa de'i rang rig pa'i bya ba de ni / gang phyir ji ltar gnas don te //
translated: Therefore, the activity of the self-cognition of that aspectüîΩis the object that is cognized,

original: de bzhin de ni gsal ba yin //
analyzed: de bzhin de ni gsal ba yin //
translated: and it is just like that.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is,

original: gang gi phyir rtogs pa la ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa 'dod pa'i rnam pas sngon po la sogs pa'i don de gnas pa ste 'phos par snang ba de bzhin du don de rig pa'i rang bzhin rang rig pa gsal bar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtogs pa la ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa 'dod pa'i rnam pas sngon po la sogs pa'i don de gnas pa ste 'phos par snang ba de bzhin du don de rig pa'i rang bzhin rang rig pa gsal bar snang ba yin no //
translated: because the object, such as blue, is cognized by the aspect that is asserted to be blue, the object, such as blue, is cognized as if it were transferred to the aspect. In the same way, the nature of the cognition of the object, which is self-cognition, appears clearly.

original: de bas na rnam pa nyid tshad ma'o zhes nye bar bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa nyid tshad ma'o zhes nye bar bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the aspect itself is valid knowledge. This is the summary.

original: 'o na gal te rnam pa tshad ma yin pa de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don la rnam pa tshad mar 'gyur la shes pa'i ngo bo nyid la ni rang rig pa 'bras bu 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir yul tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rnam pa tshad ma yin pa de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don la rnam pa tshad mar 'gyur la shes pa'i ngo bo nyid la ni rang rig pa 'bras bu 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir yul tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if the aspect is valid cognition, then the external object would be the valid cognition of the aspect, and the nature of consciousness would be the result of autocognition, so the object would be different.üîΩIn response, Aryadeva says:

original: smras pa / don gnas de yi bdag nyid phyir //
analyzed: smras pa / don gnas de yi bdag nyid phyir //
translated: Because the object is the nature of that,

original: rang rig yin na'ang don rig 'dod //
analyzed: rang rig yin na'ang don rig 'dod //
translated: even if it is autocognition, it is asserted that it is the cognition of the object.

original: de phyir yul tha dad pa'ang min //
analyzed: de phyir yul tha dad pa'ang min //
translated: Therefore, the object is not different.

original: rang gi ngo bo dpyod pa na //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dpyod pa na //
translated: When the nature of the object is analyzed,

original: rang rig 'bras bu yin par bshad //
analyzed: rang rig 'bras bu yin par bshad //
translated: it is explained that autocognition is the result.

original: don myong de'i bdag nyid phyir ro ;üîΩ/ zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don myong de'i bdag nyid phyir ro ; / zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because the experience of the object is its nature.

original: don dam par rang rig pa yin yang tha snyad du don rig par 'dod do //
analyzed: don dam par rang rig pa yin yang tha snyad du don rig par 'dod do //
translated: Even though autocognition is ultimate, conventionally it is asserted that it is the cognition of the object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don gyi rnam pa de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the aspect of the object is its nature.

original: rang rig pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of autocognition.

original: de bas na tshad ma dang 'bras bu dag la yul tha dad pa yang med de /
analyzed: de bas na tshad ma dang 'bras bu dag la yul tha dad pa yang med de /
translated: Therefore, valid knowledge and its result do not have different objects.

original: phyi rol nyid du zhen pa'i 'bras bur 'jug cing tshad ma yang de nyid du yin pa de'i phyir yul tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol nyid du zhen pa'i 'bras bur 'jug cing tshad ma yang de nyid du yin pa de'i phyir yul tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The result is engaged as the result of the conception of external objects, and valid cognition is also that. Therefore, the object does not exist separately.

original: de lta mod kyi 'o na phyi rol gyi don la tshad ma dang 'bras bur rig par zhen par gyur pa phyi rol rang rig par brjod de /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'o na phyi rol gyi don la tshad ma dang 'bras bur rig par zhen par gyur pa phyi rol rang rig par brjod de /
translated: But if external objects are conceived to be the result of valid cognition, then external objects are said to be self-knowing.

original: 'bras bu ni zhen pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni zhen pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: This is because the result depends on the conception.

original: rang rig pa 'bras bur brjod pa zhen pa la ltos nas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang rig pa 'bras bur brjod pa zhen pa la ltos nas ma yin gyi /
translated: Self-knowing is not said to be the result in dependence on conception.

original: 'on kyang don rig par zhen par gyur pa na ngo bo nyid ci yin zhes rang bzhin dpyod pas rang rig pa 'bras bur brjod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang don rig par zhen par gyur pa na ngo bo nyid ci yin zhes rang bzhin dpyod pas rang rig pa 'bras bur brjod de /
translated: However, when the conception of the knowledge of objects occurs, the nature of that is analyzed, and self-knowing is said to be the result.

original: don rig pa de'i bdag nyid de rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don rig pa de'i bdag nyid de rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because the knowledge of objects is of the nature of that, because it is of the nature of self-knowing.

original: de'i phyir don dam pa la ltos nas rang rig pa nyid @129a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam pa la ltos nas rang rig pa nyid @129a * //
translated: Therefore, in terms of the ultimate, self-knowing is

original: yin la / tha snyad la ltos nas ni don rig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yin la / tha snyad la ltos nas ni don rig pa'i phyir /
translated: in terms of convention, because it is the knowledge of objects.

original: shes pa'i rnam pa nyams su myong bar gyur pa tshad ma ste /
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa nyams su myong bar gyur pa tshad ma ste /
translated: The experience of the aspect of consciousness is valid knowledge.

original: rang rig ni 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: rang rig ni 'bras bu yin la /
translated: Self-awareness is the result.

original: tshad ma ni gzhan bya'o zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma ni gzhan bya'o zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúValid knowledge is different‚Äù is the position.

original: 'o na gal te don gyi ngo bo nyid kyis mi snang gi /
analyzed: 'o na gal te don gyi ngo bo nyid kyis mi snang gi /
translated: If the entity of the object does not appear,

original: 'on kyang shes pa nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can du snang ba de lta na /
analyzed: 'on kyang shes pa nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can du snang ba de lta na /
translated: but consciousness itself appears in the aspect of blue and so on,

original: ji ltar don gzhal byar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar don gzhal byar 'gyur /
translated: how can the object be the object of comprehension?

original: 'on te don ni shes pa dang 'dra bar ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te don ni shes pa dang 'dra bar ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If the object is the object of comprehension because it is similar to consciousness,

original: gzhal bya yin na ni don ma mthong ba shes pa dang 'dra bar ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: gzhal bya yin na ni don ma mthong ba shes pa dang 'dra bar ji ltar shes she na /
translated: how is the object that is not seen known to be similar to consciousness?

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩde 'dra ba 'am mi 'dra ba'i de ltar snang bar gyur pa yis //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / de 'dra ba 'am mi 'dra ba'i de ltar snang bar gyur pa yis //
translated: Here we say:üîΩWhether it is similar or not, the cause of consciousness

original: shes pa'i rgyu ni don yin te //
analyzed: shes pa'i rgyu ni don yin te //
translated: is the object that appears in that way.

original: don de gzhal byar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: don de gzhal byar 'dod pa'o //
translated: That object is asserted to be the object of comprehension.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here we say:

original: don snang ba'i phyir gzhal ba nyid du 'jog pa ni ma yin zhing /
analyzed: don snang ba'i phyir gzhal ba nyid du 'jog pa ni ma yin zhing /
translated: The object is not posited as the object of comprehension because it appears.

original: shes pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir yang ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it like consciousness, because

original: 'on kyang de sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam par snang bar gyur pa la de dang 'dra ba'am mi 'dra ba'am mi 'dra ba'i shes pa'i don ni rgyu yin no zhes bya ba de tsam zhig gzhal bya'i don du khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam par snang bar gyur pa la de dang 'dra ba'am mi 'dra ba'am mi 'dra ba'i shes pa'i don ni rgyu yin no zhes bya ba de tsam zhig gzhal bya'i don du khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: it is the object of consciousness. However, it is only the object of consciousness that is accepted as the object of comprehension, to the extent that it is the cause of consciousness that appears in the aspect of blue, yellow, etc., whether it is similar or dissimilar to consciousness.

original: 'dir brtsad pa /
analyzed: 'dir brtsad pa /
translated: Here, there is debate:

original: gal te ji zhig ltar de yis //
analyzed: gal te ji zhig ltar de yis //
translated: If, in some way, it abandons

original: don dngos spangs nas snang ba can //
analyzed: don dngos spangs nas snang ba can //
translated: the entity of the object and appears,

original: ji ltar don 'dzin can //
analyzed: ji ltar don 'dzin can //
translated: how does it apprehend the object?

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is saying:

original: ji ltar yang ji zhig ltar 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i rnam pas shes pa rang rig par snang ba can de'i don gyi rang bzhin sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can nyid spangs nas phyi rol gyi don 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur te ma yin no
analyzed: ji ltar yang ji zhig ltar 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i rnam pas shes pa rang rig par snang ba can de'i don gyi rang bzhin sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can nyid spangs nas phyi rol gyi don 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur te ma yin no
translated: In some way, how does consciousness, which appears as self-awareness in the aspect of the desirable and undesirable, abandon the entity of the object, which is the nature of the aspect of blue, etc., and how does it come to apprehend an external object? It does not.

original: // 'di ltar yul nye ba'i don med kyang yul du snang ba can smig rgyu la chur shes pa mthong ba de'i phyir snang ba tsam gyis don 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: // 'di ltar yul nye ba'i don med kyang yul du snang ba can smig rgyu la chur shes pa mthong ba de'i phyir snang ba tsam gyis don 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, although the object is not present, one sees the cognition of water in a mirage that appears as water. Therefore, it is not reasonable to apprehend an object on the basis of mere appearance.

original: 'on te yul dang dus gzhan gyi chu la dmigs nas smig rgyu la chur shes par 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te yul dang dus gzhan gyi chu la dmigs nas smig rgyu la chur shes par 'dod na /
translated: But if one maintains that the cognition of water in a mirage is based on water in another place and time,

original: yul dang dus gzhan gyi chu smig rgyu la chur shes pa'i yul yin par gang gis shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul dang dus gzhan gyi chu smig rgyu la chur shes pa'i yul yin par gang gis shes par 'gyur te /
translated: how can one know that water in another place and time is the object of the cognition of water in a mirage?

original: sngar gyi chur snang bas ni sngar mthong ba de'i yul dang dus la dmigs pa'i phyir yin gyi da ltar mthong bas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sngar gyi chur snang bas ni sngar mthong ba de'i yul dang dus la dmigs pa'i phyir yin gyi da ltar mthong bas ni ma yin te /
translated: It is because the appearance of water in the past is based on water in a place and time previously seen, not because of what is seen now,

original: de da ltar byung ba'i dus dang yul gyi chu la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de da ltar byung ba'i dus dang yul gyi chu la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because what is seen now is based on water in the present place and time.

original: de'i phyir sngar nyams su myong ba'i chu ni smig rgyu la chur shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir don gyis stong par brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar nyams su myong ba'i chu ni smig rgyu la chur shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir don gyis stong par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, since the water experienced in the past is not the object of the cognition of water in a mirage, it is said to be empty of an object.

original: 'on te @129b gnod pa can gyi shes pas sngar gyi shes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te @129b gnod pa can gyi shes pas sngar gyi shes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is the previous cognition because it is the cognition of the one who is harmed,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: chu med par yang ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu med par yang ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it shows that there is no water.

original: gzhan yang don gyis stong par ma gyur cig snyam nas shes pa'i yul ston par byed na /
analyzed: gzhan yang don gyis stong par ma gyur cig snyam nas shes pa'i yul ston par byed na /
translated: Moreover, if you say that the object is shown to be empty of an object,

original: gal te yang yul de dang dus der don med pa de'i tshe yul dang dus de'i rnam pa can du snang ba ni don gyis stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te yang yul de dang dus der don med pa de'i tshe yul dang dus de'i rnam pa can du snang ba ni don gyis stong pa nyid do //
translated: but at that time and place there is no object, then the appearance in the aspect of that time and place is empty of an object.

original: gzhan yang gang gi tshe yul gang dus gzhan gyi chu rtogs pa de'i tshe thams cad kyis thams cad mthong ba can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi tshe yul gang dus gzhan gyi chu rtogs pa de'i tshe thams cad kyis thams cad mthong ba can du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, when one realizes water in a certain place and time, at that time and place, it would be seen by everyone.

original: dper na sngar mthong ba'am skye ba gzhan du son pa'i rmi lam la sogs par mthong ba snang ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na sngar mthong ba'am skye ba gzhan du son pa'i rmi lam la sogs par mthong ba snang ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as what was seen before or what was seen in another life appears in a dream,

original: sngar ma mthong ba'i yul gzhan dang dus gzhan du son pa yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar ma mthong ba'i yul gzhan dang dus gzhan du son pa yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: so what was not seen before would be seen in another place and time.

original: des na yul dang dus gzhan la sogs pa'i dngos po snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na yul dang dus gzhan la sogs pa'i dngos po snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since objects, times, and so forth are not things that appear,

original: ji ltar yul 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar yul 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: how could they be apprehended?

original: 'khrul pa'i shes pa la don med kyang de'i rnam pa can du snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na bden /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i shes pa la don med kyang de'i rnam pa can du snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na bden /
translated: It is true that although objects do not exist for erroneous consciousnesses, they appear to have aspects.

original: de 'dra kho bos kyang mi shes //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de 'dra kho bos kyang mi shes // zhes bya ba la /
translated: We do not know such an apprehension of objects.

original: don 'dzin pa de 'dra mi shes te de'i don ngo bo nyid kyis mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don 'dzin pa de 'dra mi shes te de'i don ngo bo nyid kyis mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: We do not know such an apprehension of objects because we do not see their object by way of its own entity.

original: de'i phyir thams cad rang rig pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad rang rig pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, all is reflexive awareness alone.

original: 'o na gal te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can med na ji ltar 'jig rten pa de ltar zhen pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can med na ji ltar 'jig rten pa de ltar zhen pa yin zhe na /
translated: If there are no aspects of objects and apprehenders, how is it that worldly people are attached in that way?

original: blo yi bdag nyid cha med kyang /
analyzed: blo yi bdag nyid cha med kyang /
translated: Although the nature of awareness is partless,

original: phyin ci log tu mthong ba yis //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu mthong ba yis //
translated: through seeing incorrectly,üîΩthe awareness of objects and apprehenders

original: gzung dang 'dzin par rig pa dag / tha dad bzhin du mtshon par 'gyur //üîΩji ltar sngags sogs kyis dkrugs pas //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin par rig pa dag / tha dad bzhin du mtshon par 'gyur // ji ltar sngags sogs kyis dkrugs pas //
translated: is imputed as if it were different.üîΩThrough the power of spells and so forth,

original: dbang po rnams la 'jim dum sogs //
analyzed: dbang po rnams la 'jim dum sogs //
translated: to the sense faculties lumps of clay and so forthüîΩappear as horses and elephants.

original: de yis gzugs dang bral ba yang //
analyzed: de yis gzugs dang bral ba yang //
translated: And that which is free from form

original: rnam pa gzhan du snang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du snang bar 'gyur //
translated: appears in another way.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩgzung ba dang 'dzin par zhen pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te / gzung ba dang 'dzin par zhen pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, it is said.

original: zhen pa nyid rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhen pa nyid rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The adherence to the apprehended object and apprehending subject does not exist because adherence itself is the nature of self-awareness.

original: tha snyad btags pa yang shes pa nyid de /
analyzed: tha snyad btags pa yang shes pa nyid de /
translated: The conventional designation is also consciousness itself.

original: shes pa de'i ngo bo dpyis phyin pa yin no zhes bstan to /
analyzed: shes pa de'i ngo bo dpyis phyin pa yin no zhes bstan to /
translated: The nature of that consciousness is fully understood.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: bam po bco lnga pa /
analyzed: bam po bco lnga pa /
translated: Fifteenth Section

original: de'i phyir blo'i bdag nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i cha dang bral ba yin yang gang dag phyin ci log tu mthong ba'i skye bo de dag gis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang myong ba de dag tha dad pa bzhin du snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir blo'i bdag nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i cha dang bral ba yin yang gang dag phyin ci log tu mthong ba'i skye bo de dag gis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang myong ba de dag tha dad pa bzhin du snang ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, although the nature of cognition is free from the aspects of apprehended object and apprehending subject, for those beings who see erroneously, the apprehended object, apprehending subject, and experience appear as if separate.

original: de nyid du shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid du shes par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, they are understood as such.

original: shes pa la snang ba can gyi @130a * //
analyzed: shes pa la snang ba can gyi @130a * //
translated: The appearance in consciousness

original: sngon po la yod par sgro btags pa de'i gzung ba nyid du sems pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sngon po la yod par sgro btags pa de'i gzung ba nyid du sems pa yin gyi /
translated: The mind conceives that the superimposed object that exists in blue is apprehended by the eye consciousness.

original: mthong ba ni gdon mi za bar dngos po med pa yin pa de bas na de'i don du skye bo rnams sems pa yin pas mthong ba dang mthun pa'i sngon po ci'i phyir tshad ma ma yin zhes de ltar dpyad par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba ni gdon mi za bar dngos po med pa yin pa de bas na de'i don du skye bo rnams sems pa yin pas mthong ba dang mthun pa'i sngon po ci'i phyir tshad ma ma yin zhes de ltar dpyad par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But seeing is definitely not a nonexistent object, and therefore it is not to be analyzed in this way: ‚ÄúWhy is blue, which is concordant with seeing, not a valid knowledge?‚Äù

original: 'o na gal te rang gis mthong ba mdun na med kyang gzhan gyis de mthong bas /üîΩde'i phyir de mthong ba las don yod pa nyid du shes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rang gis mthong ba mdun na med kyang gzhan gyis de mthong bas / de'i phyir de mthong ba las don yod pa nyid du shes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if what is seen by oneself is not in front of oneself, then since it is seen by another,üîΩhow is it that one knows that the object exists because it is seen by another?

original: gzhan gyis don mthong ba yod pa yang tshad ma cis grub ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis don mthong ba yod pa yang tshad ma cis grub ste /
translated: By what valid knowledge is the existence of the object seen by another established?

original: gzhan gyis mthong bar nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mthong bar nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the seeing by another is not experienced.

original: 'on te mig phye ba las phan tshun gyi tha snyad mthong ba'i phyir rang dang gzhan gyis mthong ba'i don gcig pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mig phye ba las phan tshun gyi tha snyad mthong ba'i phyir rang dang gzhan gyis mthong ba'i don gcig pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But if the eyes are open, the conventions of each other seeing are seen. Therefore, is the object seen by oneself and another not the same?

original: tha snyad mthong ba las rang dang mtshungs par gzhan gyi rgyud mthong ba dang mthun par rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: tha snyad mthong ba las rang dang mtshungs par gzhan gyi rgyud mthong ba dang mthun par rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not that one infers the existence of something in another‚Äôs continuum in accordance with what one has seen in one‚Äôs own continuum?

original: phyi rol pa ni gcig pa nyid du dpag par rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol pa ni gcig pa nyid du dpag par rung ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible to infer identity from the non-Buddhists,

original: du ba mthong ba las tshang bang yod pas ri'i phyogs gcig tu tshang bang nyid dpog pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang gal te 'dra ba'i tha snyad mthong ba las rang dang gzhan gyi mthong ba gcig rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa de lta na yang byad kyi dkyil 'khor mthong ba las gzhan gyi rgyud la bde ba yod pas rang gi rgyud kyi bde ba
analyzed: du ba mthong ba las tshang bang yod pas ri'i phyogs gcig tu tshang bang nyid dpog pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang gal te 'dra ba'i tha snyad mthong ba las rang dang gzhan gyi mthong ba gcig rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa de lta na yang byad kyi dkyil 'khor mthong ba las gzhan gyi rgyud la bde ba yod pas rang gi rgyud kyi bde ba
translated: because when one sees smoke, one does not infer that there is a fire on one side of the mountain.üîΩMoreover, if one infers the existence of something in another‚Äôs continuum from seeing the convention of similarity, then one would infer that the pleasure in one‚Äôs own continuum

original: dang lhan cig gcig pa nyid du rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang lhan cig gcig pa nyid du rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro //
translated: is identical to the pleasure in another‚Äôs continuum from seeing the circle of the face.

original: de'i phyir bdag tu mthong bas gzhag pa'i sngon po la sogs pa gzung ba'i rnam pa can bzhin du gzhan gyi shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag tu mthong bas gzhag pa'i sngon po la sogs pa gzung ba'i rnam pa can bzhin du gzhan gyi shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, like the aspect of the apprehended, such as blue, which is posited by the view of self, it is not the domain of another consciousness.

original: 'on kyang gzhan gyis mthong ba dang tha dad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan gyis mthong ba dang tha dad pa nyid yin no //
translated: However, it is different from what is seen by another.

original: de bas na gzung ba la sogs pa'i cha shas med do zhes zer ba ni rmongs pa'i shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzung ba la sogs pa'i cha shas med do zhes zer ba ni rmongs pa'i shes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the claim that there is no part, such as the apprehended, is the cognition of the ignorant.

original: dper na sngags dang mig nad la sogs pas dkrugs pa'i dbang po gang la yod pa'i skyes bu de rnams 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa la rnam pa gzhan du rta dang glang po la sogs par snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na sngags dang mig nad la sogs pas dkrugs pa'i dbang po gang la yod pa'i skyes bu de rnams 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa la rnam pa gzhan du rta dang glang po la sogs par snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: For example, for those persons whose faculties are disturbed by spells, eye disease, and so on, a lump of clay and so on appears in a different aspect, such as a horse, an elephant, and so on.

original: de bas na glang po la sogs pa'i gzugs de dang bral pa yin yang de ltar snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na glang po la sogs pa'i gzugs de dang bral pa yin yang de ltar snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even though the form of an elephant and so on is absent, it appears as such.

original: de bzhin du gzung ba dang bral ba la sogs pa'i shes pa yang de ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzung ba dang bral ba la sogs pa'i shes pa yang de ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, consciousness, which is free from the apprehended and so on, appears in that way.

original: 'on te sngags la sogs pas bskyed pa'i glang po che la sogs pa yod @130b pa nyid snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sngags la sogs pas bskyed pa'i glang po che la sogs pa yod @130b pa nyid snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you think that the elephant, etc. that are generated by the mantra, etc. do exist,

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩde ltar ma dkrugs mig can la //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / de ltar ma dkrugs mig can la //
translated: that is not so.üîΩBecause those who have eyes that are not disturbed

original: de dag mthong ba med phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag mthong ba med phyir ro //
translated: do not see them.

original: dper na thag ring mya ngam na //
analyzed: dper na thag ring mya ngam na //
translated: For example, in a great desert

original: chung du'ang chen por snang ba bzhin //
analyzed: chung du'ang chen por snang ba bzhin //
translated: even a small thing appears to be great.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩdper na sngags la sogs pas dkrugs pa'i mig can gyi skyes bus rta la sogs pa mthong ba de bzhin du de lta bu nyid de glang po che la sogs pa'i rnam par sngags la sogs pas ma dkrugs pa'i mig can gyis kyes bus 'jim pa'i dum bu
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / dper na sngags la sogs pas dkrugs pa'i mig can gyi skyes bus rta la sogs pa mthong ba de bzhin du de lta bu nyid de glang po che la sogs pa'i rnam par sngags la sogs pas ma dkrugs pa'i mig can gyis kyes bus 'jim pa'i dum bu
translated: Here,üîΩjust as a person whose eyes are disturbed by a mantra, etc. sees horses, etc., so too those who have eyes that are not disturbed by a mantra, etc. do not see those things, such as a lump of clay, etc.,

original: la sogs pa de dag tu ma mthong ba'i phyir rta dang glang po'i ngo bo nyid ni med pa yin no //
analyzed: la sogs pa de dag tu ma mthong ba'i phyir rta dang glang po'i ngo bo nyid ni med pa yin no //
translated: in the form of an elephant, etc. Therefore the nature of a horse and elephant does not exist.

original: gal te yang sngags la sogs pa'i mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pas glang po che la sogs pa skyed pa'i nus pa yod pa srid na /
analyzed: gal te yang sngags la sogs pa'i mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pas glang po che la sogs pa skyed pa'i nus pa yod pa srid na /
translated: If it is possible that the power of mantras and so on can generate elephants and so on,

original: 'di la ji ltar gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la ji ltar gzhag par bya ste /
translated: then how can you refute this?

original: 'di ltar mya ngam gyi thang la thag ring na gnas pa'i sdong po la sogs pa chung ngu yang ri tsam dang chen po dang ring po snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mya ngam gyi thang la thag ring na gnas pa'i sdong po la sogs pa chung ngu yang ri tsam dang chen po dang ring po snang ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, on a desert plain, a small tree that is far away appears to be as large as a mountain, and a large tree appears to be far away.

original: yon gal te gzung ba la sogs pa'i cha shas med na ji ltar gzhal bya dang tshad ma dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yon gal te gzung ba la sogs pa'i cha shas med na ji ltar gzhal bya dang tshad ma dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag par bya zhe na /
translated: If the object of comprehension and so on do not have parts, how can you posit the object of comprehension, valid knowledge, and the result of valid knowledge?

original: gzhal bya 'jal byed 'bras gnas pa //
analyzed: gzhal bya 'jal byed 'bras gnas pa //
translated: Although the object of comprehension, the comprehender, and the result of comprehension do not exist,

original: yod pa min yang gzung ba dang // 'dzin pa rig pa ji lta bar //
analyzed: yod pa min yang gzung ba dang // 'dzin pa rig pa ji lta bar //
translated: just as the awareness of the apprehended and apprehender appears,

original: rjes su snang bzhin 'di byas so //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rjes su snang bzhin 'di byas so // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: so too is this constructed.

original: dang po cha shas med pa'i sngon po mthong ba de'i rjes su snang ba ni zhen pa ste /
analyzed: dang po cha shas med pa'i sngon po mthong ba de'i rjes su snang ba ni zhen pa ste /
translated: First, the appearance that follows the perception of a partless blue is attachment.

original: mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: It is a conception that follows after seeing.

original: de las ma 'das bzhin du yang gzhal bya dang 'jal byed dang 'bras bu de dag tha dad par gnas par byed de /
analyzed: de las ma 'das bzhin du yang gzhal bya dang 'jal byed dang 'bras bu de dag tha dad par gnas par byed de /
translated: Even though it does not go beyond that, it makes the object of comprehension, the means of comprehension, and the result appear as if they were separate.

original: gang rnams rtog pas bzhag pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rig pa ni gzung ba'i rnam pa gzhal bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gang rnams rtog pas bzhag pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rig pa ni gzung ba'i rnam pa gzhal bar bya ba yin la /
translated: The cognition that is posited by conception as the apprehender and the apprehended is the aspect of the apprehended, which is the object of comprehension.

original: nges par nus pa tshad ma yin zhing /
analyzed: nges par nus pa tshad ma yin zhing /
translated: The ability to ascertain is the means of comprehension, which is the valid cognition.

original: rig pa ni 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: rig pa ni 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The cognition is the result.

original: 'on te bdag yongs su gyur pa'i rang bzhin can gzung ba la sogs pa dang / sngon po la sogs pa'i bye brag dag thams cad yin par gyur pa'i phyir bdag gnyis su med par rig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bdag yongs su gyur pa'i rang bzhin can gzung ba la sogs pa dang / sngon po la sogs pa'i bye brag dag thams cad yin par gyur pa'i phyir bdag gnyis su med par rig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the self, which has the nature of transformation, is all of the distinctions of the apprehended and so on, such as blue and so on, then the cognition of the nonexistence of the two selves is not tenable.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: de lta min na sna tshogs kyi //üîΩngo bo snang can dngos gcig la //
analyzed: de lta min na sna tshogs kyi // ngo bo snang can dngos gcig la //
translated: If it were not so,üîΩthen how could the entities that appearüîΩas having the nature of multiplicity

original: ji ltar rnam pa bden 'gyur te //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa bden 'gyur te //
translated: be truly existent as a single entity?

original: gcig pa nyid de nyams phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid de nyams phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because singularity would be undermined.

original: gzhan du na gal te gzung ba la sogs pa bden pa yin na /üîΩde'i tshe bdag gci @131a * //
analyzed: gzhan du na gal te gzung ba la sogs pa bden pa yin na / de'i tshe bdag gci @131a * //
translated: Otherwise, if the apprehended object and so on were real,

original: pu'am rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid can gyi rnam pa gzung ba la sogs pa bden par ji ltar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pu'am rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid can gyi rnam pa gzung ba la sogs pa bden par ji ltar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time, how could the apprehended object and so on, which are of the nature of manifold aspects, be real in the nature of a self or consciousness?

original: bdag dang shes pa de'i gcig pa nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang shes pa de'i gcig pa nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They could not be, because the singularity of the self and consciousness would be undermined.

original: sna tshogs su snang bar gyur bas de'i tshe gcig pa nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs su snang bar gyur bas de'i tshe gcig pa nyams pa yin no //
translated: Because of appearing as manifold, at that time singularity would be undermined.

original: gzhan gyis gzhan nyid nyams phyir dang // zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gzhan nyid nyams phyir dang // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because of the undermining of difference by another,

original: rnam pa bden par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa bden par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: how could the aspects be real?

original: gzhan gyis gzhan nyid ces bya ba na tha dad par mthong ba de tsam yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gzhan nyid ces bya ba na tha dad par mthong ba de tsam yin te /
translated: Because of the undermining of difference by another, that is, because of seeing difference, it is merely that.

original: de lta ma yin na gzhan gyis gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gzhan gyis gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would not be difference by another.

original: 'on te sna tshogs tshangs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te sna tshogs tshangs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if the manifold is of the nature of Brahman,

original: tha dad pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad pa med do zhe na /
translated: there is no difference.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: dngos ma mthong phyir tha dad yin //
analyzed: dngos ma mthong phyir tha dad yin //
translated: Because the thing is not seen to be different.

original: dngos po tha dad med mthong blos //üîΩtha dad med par nges pa yin //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad med mthong blos // tha dad med par nges pa yin //
translated: The cognition that sees the thing as undifferentiated

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Ascertains the absence of difference.

original: gzung ba la sogs pa tha dad pas sngon po la sogs pa tha dad pa ni tha dad pa ma yin par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzung ba la sogs pa tha dad pas sngon po la sogs pa tha dad pa ni tha dad pa ma yin par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The difference of blue, etc., from the apprehended object, etc., is not reasonable as undifferentiated,

original: tha mi dad pa'i dngos po ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i dngos po ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the undifferentiated thing is not seen.

original: gal te sna tshogs pa thams cad gcig gi ngo bo nyid du snang ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te sna tshogs pa thams cad gcig gi ngo bo nyid du snang ba yin na /
translated: If all the variety appears as the nature of one thing,

original: de'i tshe gcig pa nyid du khas blangs na legs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe gcig pa nyid du khas blangs na legs so //
translated: then it is better to accept it as one.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po tha dad pa med par mthong ba'i blos ni tha dad pa med bar nges par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po tha dad pa med par mthong ba'i blos ni tha dad pa med bar nges par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Because the cognition that sees the thing as undifferentiated ascertains the absence of difference,

original: sngon po la sogs pa rnams dang bde ba la sogs pa tha dad pa rnams tha mi dad par snang ba ni ma yin pa de'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad bdag yongs su gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa rnams dang bde ba la sogs pa tha dad pa rnams tha mi dad par snang ba ni ma yin pa de'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad bdag yongs su gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but the appearance of the difference of blue, etc., and pleasure, etc., as undifferentiated does not exist. Therefore, all the world is not a transformation of the self.

original: gzhan yang gal te sngon po la sogs pa tha dad pa rang gsal ba yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te sngon po la sogs pa tha dad pa rang gsal ba yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the different things such as blue are self-evident,

original: de lta na ni de dag bden par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni de dag bden par 'gyur ro //
translated: then they would be real.

original: 'on te gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin na ni ji ltar gsal ba ma yin par gyur pa gsal ba'i bdag nyid las tha dad par mi 'gyur /

analyzed: byed par bsgrub par byas nas 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyid gzhung der bstan pa de'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: Having established it as the agent, the aspect of apprehension itself is taught in that text. Therefore there is no contradiction.

original: de bas na phyi rol gyi don la rang rig pa 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: de bas na phyi rol gyi don la rang rig pa 'bras bu yin la /
translated: Therefore, self-awareness is the result in regard to external objects.

original: de'i rnam pa ni tshad ma'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa ni tshad ma'o //
translated: Its aspect is the valid cognition.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa mi 'thad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa mi 'thad pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it untenable that consciousness has an aspect?

original: 'di ltar gal te don gyi rnam pas bsgyur ba dang ldan pa'i shes pa dang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te don gyi rnam pas bsgyur ba dang ldan pa'i shes pa dang ba yin te /
translated: In this way, if consciousness is clear and possesses the transformation of the aspect of the object,

original: dper na me long gi ngos bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na me long gi ngos bzhin no //
translated: it is like the surface of a mirror.

original: de ltar na mig la sogs pa yang snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na mig la sogs pa yang snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, the eyes and so on would also appear,

original: dpen na me long dang nye bar gyur na thams cad snang ba bzhin du 'gyur thang ba las mig la sogs pa snang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dpen na me long dang nye bar gyur na thams cad snang ba bzhin du 'gyur thang ba las mig la sogs pa snang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: just as when something is placed near a mirror, everything appears as if it were in the mirror, but the eyes and so on do not appear in that way.

original: 'on re mig ni snang ba'i rgyu yin te dper na me long bzhin no zer na /
analyzed: 'on re mig ni snang ba'i rgyu yin te dper na me long bzhin no zer na /
translated: If you say that the eyes are the cause of appearance, like a mirror,

original: 'o na ni gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba mig la 'char bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba mig la 'char bar 'gyur te /
translated: then the form and so on would appear in the eyes,

original: dpen na snang ba thams cad me long la 'char ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dpen na snang ba thams cad me long la 'char ba bzhin no //
translated: just as everything appears in a mirror.

original: 'on te me long bzhin shes pa dang ba la don snang ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te me long bzhin shes pa dang ba la don snang ba ma yin gyi /
translated: But if the clear consciousness is not the appearance of the object, like a mirror,üîΩthen the object is not the cause of the appearance of the object.

original: 'on kyang don rung ba'i yul la gnas pas shes pa don gyi rnam par cad du skye ba ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang don rung ba'i yul la gnas pas shes pa don gyi rnam par cad du skye ba ste /
translated: However, if you say that consciousness arises in the aspect of the object because it abides in a suitable object,

original: don de las skyes pa'i phyir ro zer na ni /
analyzed: don de las skyes pa'i phyir ro zer na ni /
translated: then it would arise from that object.

original: de lta na ni shes pa mig las skyes pa'i phyir mig gi rnam pa can nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de lta na ni shes pa mig las skyes pa'i phyir mig gi rnam pa can nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: In that case, since consciousness arises from the eye, wouldn‚Äôt it have the aspect of the eye?

original: de bas na mig kyang rig par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na mig kyang rig par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the eye would be aware.

original: 'dir lan btab pa /
analyzed: 'dir lan btab pa /
translated: Here, the reply is:

original: gang phyir rnam par shes pa kun //
analyzed: gang phyir rnam par shes pa kun //
translated: Because all consciousnesses

original: yul rnams las ni 'byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: yul rnams las ni 'byung ba'i phyir //
translated: arise from objects,

original: de las gzhan rgyu yod na yang //
analyzed: de las gzhan rgyu yod na yang //
translated: even if there are other causes,

original: rnam 'gas yul gyis byas pa can//üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam 'gas yul gyis byas pa can// zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: in what way are they produced by objects?

original: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa thams cad ji lta bu'i yul rnams las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa thams cad ji lta bu'i yul rnams las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all consciousnesses arise from objects,

original: rnam pa jis kyang yul gyis byas pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa jis kyang yul gyis byas pa yin te /

original: de lta bu yul de las gzhan pa dbang po la sogs pa rgyu yin yang de'i rnam pa can du ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de lta bu yul de las gzhan pa dbang po la sogs pa rgyu yin yang de'i rnam pa can du ma yin zhing /
translated: Even if there are other causes, such as the sense faculties, they are not in the aspect of those objects.

original: skyes pa tsam gyis de'i rnam pa can du mi 'gyur ro //üîΩ'di ltar / dper na zas dang dus la sogs //
analyzed: skyes pa tsam gyis de'i rnam pa can du mi 'gyur ro // 'di ltar / dper na zas dang dus la sogs //
translated: It does not become the aspect of that merely by being produced.üîΩFor example:

original: bu skye ba yi rgyu yin yang //
analyzed: bu skye ba yi rgyu yin yang //

original: pha ma'i cha byad 'dzin byed kyi //
analyzed: pha ma'i cha byad 'dzin byed kyi //
translated: but the child takes on the form of either the father or the mother,

original: gzhan yang rung ba'i ma yin bzhin /üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rung ba'i ma yin bzhin / zhes bya ba la /

original: bu skye ba'i rgyu zas dang dus la sogs pa yin yang /
analyzed: bu skye ba'i rgyu zas dang dus la sogs pa yin yang /

original: pha dang ma de dag gi nang nas @133b gang yang rung ba gcig gi 'brel ba'i cha byad bu yis 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: pha dang ma de dag gi nang nas @133b gang yang rung ba gcig gi 'brel ba'i cha byad bu yis 'dzin gyi /

original: kha zas la sogs pa gzhan gyi ma yin la /
analyzed: kha zas la sogs pa gzhan gyi ma yin la /
translated: but not the form of something else, such as food.

original: pha ma gnyi ga'i yang gzugs 'dzin pa ma yin no //üîΩde bzhin du shes pa yang don gyi rnam pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: pha ma gnyi ga'i yang gzugs 'dzin pa ma yin no // de bzhin du shes pa yang don gyi rnam pa nyid yin gyi /

original: gzhan gyi ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, consciousness is the aspect of the object, but it is not the aspect of something else.

original: 'on te shes pa yul gyi rnam pa can yin mod kyi ;
analyzed: 'on te shes pa yul gyi rnam pa can yin mod kyi ;
translated: Even if consciousness is the aspect of the object,

original: mig ni rnam pa can ni ma yin pa de ltar na yang smig rgyu yin pa'i phyir rig par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: mig ni rnam pa can ni ma yin pa de ltar na yang smig rgyu yin pa'i phyir rig par 'gyur ro zhe na /

original: yul dang de las gzhan pa dag / de rgyu nyid du mtshungs na yang //
analyzed: yul dang de las gzhan pa dag / de rgyu nyid du mtshungs na yang //
translated: And even though the object and something other than that object are equal in being the cause of that consciousness,

original: de'i cha yul nyid du 'dod de //
analyzed: de'i cha yul nyid du 'dod de //
translated: only the object is asserted to be the object.

original: de med na de 'byung mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de med na de 'byung mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because if it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.

analyzed: yul dang yul de las gzhan pa las rnam par shes pa de'i rgyu nyid du mtshungs na yang /

original: dmigs pa kho na yul du 'dod de /üîΩde'i rjes su byed pa'i cha med pa yul nyid du dmigs pa la sogs pa mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dmigs pa kho na yul du 'dod de / de'i rjes su byed pa'i cha med pa yul nyid du dmigs pa la sogs pa mi 'gyur te /
translated: only the object is asserted to be the object.üîΩBecause if it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.üîΩIf it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.üîΩIf it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.

original: de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i rgyu yul yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i rgyu yul yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.

analyzed: 'on te snang ba shes pa ma yin te / rang rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.üîΩIf it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.üîΩIf it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.
