analyzed: dran pa byed ba yang rang rig pa ma yin te don gyi rnam pa nyid dran pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir don nyams su myong ba yin par brtag par bya ste //
translated: If it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.üîΩIf it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.üîΩIf it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.üîΩIf it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.üîΩIf it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.üîΩIf it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.üîΩIf it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.üîΩIf it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.üîΩIf it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.üîΩIf it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.üîΩIf it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.üîΩIf it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.üîΩIf it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.üîΩIf it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.üîΩIf it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.

original: don snang ba'i phyir dang dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don snang ba'i phyir dang dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it did not exist, that consciousness would not occur.

original: shes pa ni nyams su myong ba ma yin zhing dran pa ma yin te don nyid rig pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: shes pa ni nyams su myong ba ma yin zhing dran pa ma yin te don nyid rig pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Consciousness is not an experience and is not memory because it is aware of the object itself.

original: de bas na rang dran par mi 'thad pas rang rig par gyur pa'i shes pa yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de bas na rang dran par mi 'thad pas rang rig par gyur pa'i shes pa yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, since it is not tenable that it is self-knowing, consciousness that is self-knowing does not exist.

original: de'i don gyi rnam pa can yang med de /
analyzed: de'i don gyi rnam pa can yang med de /
translated: Nor does it have the aspect of its object.

original: de'i phyir shes pa tshul gnyis pa can sgrub pa'i phyogs la mngon sum gyis gnod cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa tshul gnyis pa can sgrub pa'i phyogs la mngon sum gyis gnod cing /
translated: Therefore, with respect to the position that proves consciousness has two modes, it is undermined by direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pas kyang tshul gnyis pa can sgrub bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas kyang tshul gnyis pa can sgrub bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor can it be proven by inference that consciousness has two modes.

original: mngon sum gyis gnod pa nyid phyogs ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gnod pa nyid phyogs ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not a position that is undermined by direct perception.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang dpe las 'brel pa 'dzin pa 'dzin pa la ltos nas rjes su spog pa 'jug pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang dpe las 'brel pa 'dzin pa 'dzin pa la ltos nas rjes su spog pa 'jug pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if inference engages its object by way of apprehending a relation that is established by an example,

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa sgrub pa la dpe med de gang du yang rnam pa grub pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa sgrub pa la dpe med de gang du yang rnam pa grub pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: there is no example for proving a consciousness that has an aspect because an aspect is not established anywhere.

original: don ngang ldan pa'i sems la ni //
analyzed: don ngang ldan pa'i sems la ni //
translated: With respect to a mind that possesses an object,

original: don gyi rnam par med par dgos //
analyzed: don gyi rnam par med par dgos //
translated: The object is not present in the form of an image.

original: 'das pa'i don ni 'dzin pa na //
analyzed: 'das pa'i don ni 'dzin pa na //
translated: When the past object is apprehended,

original: tshul gnyis rang rig grub pa yin //
analyzed: tshul gnyis rang rig grub pa yin //
translated: the two modes are established by reflexive awareness.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what he says.

original: don dang ldan pa'i mig gi shes pa la don gyi rnam pa med pa can du dogs par 'gyur ba srid de /
analyzed: don dang ldan pa'i mig gi shes pa la don gyi rnam pa med pa can du dogs par 'gyur ba srid de /
translated: It is possible to doubt that the eye consciousness associated with an object does not have the form of the object,

original: @134a * // yod par gyur pa'i rnam pa don gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @134a * // yod par gyur pa'i rnam pa don gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the form that exists is the nature of the object.

original: don dang mi ldan pa'i sems skra shad la sogs pa dang 'das pa'i don 'dzin pa la ni dran pa yod pas tshul gnyis pa can dang rang rig pa grub ba yin te /
analyzed: don dang mi ldan pa'i sems skra shad la sogs pa dang 'das pa'i don 'dzin pa la ni dran pa yod pas tshul gnyis pa can dang rang rig pa grub ba yin te /
translated: But in the case of a mind not associated with an object, such as the apprehension of floating hairs and the apprehension of a past object, memory exists, and so the two modes and reflexive awareness are established.

original: 'das ba'i don 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i shes pa ni mi gsal bar gyur pa'o zhes zer ba nyid la mngon sum gyis gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'das ba'i don 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i shes pa ni mi gsal bar gyur pa'o zhes zer ba nyid la mngon sum gyis gnod pa yin no //
translated: The statement that the consciousness that apprehends a past object and so on is unclear is directly contradicted by perception.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa na de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa snang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa na de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa snang ba yin te /
translated: When it apprehends a past object and so on, the form of that object appears as its own nature.

original: de lta bas na shes pa thams cad la rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na shes pa thams cad la rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa snang ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, all cognitions appear as if they were the self of cognition.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa na yang rigs zhes bya ba'i don nyid yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa na yang rigs zhes bya ba'i don nyid yod do zhe na /
translated: But when it apprehends the past, etc., it is the meaning of the universal.üîΩNƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds:

original: smras pa / sngo sogs snang ba tha dad phyir //
analyzed: smras pa / sngo sogs snang ba tha dad phyir //
translated: Because the appearance of blue, etc. is distinct,

original: de ldan med pa'i rigs don min //
analyzed: de ldan med pa'i rigs don min //
translated: the meaning of the universal that does not possess it is not an object.

original: rigs de'ang mi rtag pa min zhing //
analyzed: rigs de'ang mi rtag pa min zhing //
translated: That universal is not impermanent,

original: rtag na ji ltar skyed byed 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtag na ji ltar skyed byed 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: but if it is permanent, how could it be a producer?

original: 'das pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa ni sngon po dang dbyibs la sogs par snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa ni sngon po dang dbyibs la sogs par snang ba'i phyir /
translated: The apprehension of the past, etc. is the appearance of blue, shape, etc.

original: de dang mi ldan pa ste sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i rigs kyi don de yul du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang mi ldan pa ste sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i rigs kyi don de yul du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the universal that does not possess it‚Äîthat is, the meaning of the universal that is devoid of the nature of blue, etc.‚Äîis not an object.

original: gzhan yang rigs de shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mi rtag na rigs nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs de shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mi rtag na rigs nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if that universal is the cause of cognition, it is impermanent, and it is not a universal.

original: 'on te rtag pa de lta na yang skyed par byed pa nyid ma yin bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'on te rtag pa de lta na yang skyed par byed pa nyid ma yin bar bstan to //
translated: But if it is permanent, then it is not a producer. This is demonstrated.

original: don te 'das pa la sogs pa 'dzin ba'i yul rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don te 'das pa la sogs pa 'dzin ba'i yul rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that the object of the apprehension of the past, etc. is the object.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: ming dang rgyu mtshan ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed la de'i tshe dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ming dang rgyu mtshan ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed la de'i tshe dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: At that time, the object is the formation that is not associated with name and reason.üîΩIn response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: smras pa / ming sogs sngar ni bkag zin na //
analyzed: smras pa / ming sogs sngar ni bkag zin na //
translated: Name and so on have already been refuted.

original: 'di ni don ldan go rims min //
analyzed: 'di ni don ldan go rims min //
translated: This is not the order of the object.

original: 'dod tsam rjes 'brel can nyid phyir //
analyzed: 'dod tsam rjes 'brel can nyid phyir //
translated: Because it is related to mere desire,

original: don gyi nus pa grub mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don gyi nus pa grub mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the capacity of the object is not established.

original: 'das pa 'dzin pa'i gzung bar bya ba ming du rgyu mtshan ma yin par sngar bkag zin pas 'dir mi brjod do //
analyzed: 'das pa 'dzin pa'i gzung bar bya ba ming du rgyu mtshan ma yin par sngar bkag zin pas 'dir mi brjod do //
translated: Name and so on have already been refuted as the cause of the object of the apprehension of the past. Since they are not mentioned here, they are not mentioned here.

original: 'di ni don dang ldan pa'i shes pa'i go rims ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni don dang ldan pa'i shes pa'i go rims ma yin te /
translated: This is not the order of the object of consciousness associated with the object.

original: gang 'di 'dod pa tsam gyis skyed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gang 'di 'dod pa tsam gyis skyed pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is generated by mere desire.

original: de dag kyang mi 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang mi 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Those are also untenable.

original: 'on te 'das pa la sogs pa'i shes pa don dang 'brel pa nyid yid no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'das pa la sogs pa'i shes pa don dang 'brel pa nyid yid no zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that the consciousness of the past, etc. is related to the object,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: gang gi phyir 'das pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'dod pa tsam gyi rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'das pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'dod pa tsam gyi rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir /
translated: Because consciousness of the past and so on is related to mere desire,

original: de la don gyi nus pa grub @134b pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la don gyi nus pa grub @134b pa ni ma yin no //
translated: the capacity of objects to produce consciousness is not established.

original: 'on te 'dod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yul gyi rnam pa can yin mod kyi nyams su myong pa ni rnam pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te 'dod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yul gyi rnam pa can yin mod kyi nyams su myong pa ni rnam pa med pa yin te /
translated: But even if consciousness of desire and so on has the aspect of an object, the experience is devoid of aspect.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: The opponent says:

original: shes pa 'di 'dra dran pa na //
analyzed: shes pa 'di 'dra dran pa na //
translated: When there is memory of this kind of consciousness,

original: de yang myong ba yod na 'byung //
analyzed: de yang myong ba yod na 'byung //
translated: it arises from the experience of that.

original: de yang don gyi rnam pas stong //üîΩde yang de ldan ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de yang don gyi rnam pas stong // de yang de ldan ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: That is also devoid of the aspect of an object.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: How could that be associated with that?

original: 'das pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa 'di lta bu ni dran pa ste /
analyzed: 'das pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa 'di lta bu ni dran pa ste /
translated: This kind of consciousness that apprehends the past is memory.

original: dan pa de yang nyams su myong pa las skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: dan pa de yang nyams su myong pa las skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: That memory arises from experience.

original: nyams su myong ba de yang don gyi rnam pas dben pa ste nyams su myong ba rnam pa med pa de las skyes par gyur ba'i dran pa de don med na sngon po la sogs pa de dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba de yang don gyi rnam pas dben pa ste nyams su myong ba rnam pa med pa de las skyes par gyur ba'i dran pa de don med na sngon po la sogs pa de dang ldan pa ste /
translated: That experience is devoid of the aspect of an object. Memory that arises from that experience that is devoid of aspect is associated with that object, such as blue.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan par ji ltar 'gyur te ma yin to //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan par ji ltar 'gyur te ma yin to //
translated: How could it be associated with the aspect of blue, etc.? It could not be!üîΩFor example, the memory of a pot that arises from seeing a pot that is devoid of the aspect of a cloth is devoid of the aspect of a cloth.

original: dper na snam bu'i rnam pa dang bral bar bum pa mthong ba las skyes pa'i bum pa dran pa ni snam bu'i rnam pa dang bral ba dang / de bzhin du bum pa dang bral bar snam bu mthong ba las skyes pa'i snam bu dran pa ni bum pa'i rnam pa bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na snam bu'i rnam pa dang bral bar bum pa mthong ba las skyes pa'i bum pa dran pa ni snam bu'i rnam pa dang bral ba dang / de bzhin du bum pa dang bral bar snam bu mthong ba las skyes pa'i snam bu dran pa ni bum pa'i rnam pa bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, the memory of a cloth that arises from seeing a cloth that is devoid of a pot is devoid of the aspect of a pot.

original: 'on kyang bum pa'i don nyid las bum pa dran pa'i bum pa'i rnam pa can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang bum pa'i don nyid las bum pa dran pa'i bum pa'i rnam pa can yin no zhe na /
translated: But the memory of a pot that arises from the very object, a pot, has the aspect of a pot.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: don las byung min de med phyir //
analyzed: don las byung min de med phyir //
translated: The aspect does not arise from the object, because it does not exist.

original: de ltar myong ba la yang 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya bal /üîΩdon las dran pa'i rnam pa 'byung ba ma yin te /üîΩde'i tshe dran ba'i dus su don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar myong ba la yang 'gyur // zhes bya bal / don las dran pa'i rnam pa 'byung ba ma yin te / de'i tshe dran ba'i dus su don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It would be like that experience.üîΩThe aspect does not arise from the object, because at the time of memory, the object does not exist.

original: 'on te chod pa'i don las de'i rnam pa can gyi dran pa 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te chod pa'i don las de'i rnam pa can gyi dran pa 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: If the memory that has its aspect arises from an object that is obstructed,

original: de lta na ni nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa de don las ma byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na ni nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa de don las ma byung ba'i phyir /
translated: In that case, because the aspect of experience does not arise from an object,

original: nyams su myong ba yang don gyi rnam pa can du grub ba ma yin no//
analyzed: nyams su myong ba yang don gyi rnam pa can du grub ba ma yin no//
translated: experience is not established as having the aspect of an object.

original: 'on te dran par gyur pa'i rnam pa ni sngar nyams su myong ba'i don nyid kyi yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te dran par gyur pa'i rnam pa ni sngar nyams su myong ba'i don nyid kyi yin gyi /
translated: But if the aspect of memory is that of the object previously experienced,

original: dran pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: it is not the nature of memory.üîΩTherefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / don gyi rnam pa de yang med //üîΩgsal ba'i rnam pas dben phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir / don gyi rnam pa de yang med // gsal ba'i rnam pas dben phyir ro //
translated: That aspect of the object does not exist,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: because it is devoid of the aspect of clarity.

original: dran par gyur pa'i rnam pa de yang phyi rol gyi don gyi yin par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dran par gyur pa'i rnam pa de yang phyi rol gyi don gyi yin par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That aspect of memory is not logically the external object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gsal ba'i rnam par shes pa las snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rnam par shes pa las snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it appears as the aspect of clear consciousness.

original: dran par gyur pa gal te don gyi rnam pa yin pa de lta na ni de yis gsal ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran par gyur pa gal te don gyi rnam pa yin pa de lta na ni de yis gsal ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the aspect of memory were that of the object, it would not be clear.

original: de bas na gsal ba'i rnam pas dben pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na gsal ba'i rnam pas dben pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it is devoid of the aspect of clarity,

original: 'di don gyi rnam pa @135a * //
analyzed: 'di don gyi rnam pa @135a * //
translated: This is the aspect of the object.üîΩ

original: can ma yin no //
analyzed: can ma yin no //
translated: But this is not the case.

original: gal te gsol ba'i rnam pa can gyi don yang gzhan yin la mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can dran pa'i gzung pa yang gzhan nyi da yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gsol ba'i rnam pa can gyi don yang gzhan yin la mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can dran pa'i gzung pa yang gzhan nyi da yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the object of the request is one thing and the object of memory, which is not clear, is another,

original: de ltan ni /
analyzed: de ltan ni /
translated: then

original: rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa de //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa de //
translated: the transformation of the aspect

original: gzhan dag gis ni shes par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni shes par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: would be known by another.

original: gal te mi gsal ba'i don yin pa de'i tshe mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can de gsal ba las tha dad par skyes bu gzhan gyis kyang de bzhin du shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mi gsal ba'i don yin pa de'i tshe mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can de gsal ba las tha dad par skyes bu gzhan gyis kyang de bzhin du shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the object is not clear, then the aspect that is not clear is produced as different from the clear aspect, and another person would know it in the same way.

original: 'on te 'di ni bdag nyid dang 'brel bas gzhan la snang bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di ni bdag nyid dang 'brel bas gzhan la snang bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is not manifest to another because it is related to the self,

original: de la yang bdag dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhig yin te /üîΩbdag gi 'bras bu yin nam /
analyzed: de la yang bdag dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhig yin te / bdag gi 'bras bu yin nam /
translated: then what is the meaning of the expression ‚Äúrelated to the self‚Äù?üîΩIs it that it is the effect of the self?

original: bdag gi ngo bo nyid yin grang na /
analyzed: bdag gi ngo bo nyid yin grang na /
translated: Or is it that it has the nature of the self?

original: de la gal te bdag gi 'bras bu yin na de'i tshe gzhan la yang snang bar 'gyur ba kho na ste /
analyzed: de la gal te bdag gi 'bras bu yin na de'i tshe gzhan la yang snang bar 'gyur ba kho na ste /
translated: If it is the effect of the self, then it would be seen by another,

original: bdag gi 'bras bu nyid ni thun mong ba las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi 'bras bu nyid ni thun mong ba las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the status of being the effect of the self is not beyond being shared.

original: 'on te bdag gi ngo bo nyid yin pa de lta na yang shes pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'on te bdag gi ngo bo nyid yin pa de lta na yang shes pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin no //
translated: But if it is the nature of the self, then it is just the nature of consciousness.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / bdag dang rtag tu 'brel yin na //
analyzed: gzhan yang / bdag dang rtag tu 'brel yin na //
translated: If it is always related to the self,

original: bstan kyang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan kyang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not be understood even if taught.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can gyi bdag dang rtag tu de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa yin na /
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can gyi bdag dang rtag tu de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa yin na /
translated: if the self is always related to it in the aspect of being unclear,

original: bstan kyang de'i rnam pa gzhan gyis rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan kyang de'i rnam pa gzhan gyis rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not be understood in another aspect even if taught.

original: 'on te gzhan gyis rtogs na ni de'i tshe ma bstan yang rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis rtogs na ni de'i tshe ma bstan yang rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is understood by another, then it would be understood even without being taught.

original: 'di ni phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa gzhan gyis bstan pa'am ma bstan par yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa gzhan gyis bstan pa'am ma bstan par yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is because it would be understood as external form and so on, whether taught by another or not.

original: 'on gang bstan pas gzhan gyis rtogs pa ni de gzhan nyid yin la gang rang gis shes pa yang gzhan pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on gang bstan pas gzhan gyis rtogs pa ni de gzhan nyid yin la gang rang gis shes pa yang gzhan pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: But if the other understands by the teaching, then it is the other that teaches, and if he understands by himself, then it is he himself that understands.

original: smras pa / re re dang ni 'brel pa na //
analyzed: smras pa / re re dang ni 'brel pa na //
translated: We reply: When there is no connection between each,

original: don gcig mngon zhen bdag nyid can //
analyzed: don gcig mngon zhen bdag nyid can //
translated: there is no single object, and the nature of adherence is not possible.

original: smra po nyan pa'i sems dag ni //
analyzed: smra po nyan pa'i sems dag ni //
translated: The minds of the speaker and the hearer

original: mtshams sbyor bar ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor bar ni mi rung ngo //
translated: cannot be connected.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: skyes bu re re dang lhan cig mi gsal ba'i don gyi 'brel pa yin na mtshams sbyor bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: skyes bu re re dang lhan cig mi gsal ba'i don gyi 'brel pa yin na mtshams sbyor bar mi 'thad do //
translated: if there is no connection of the meaning that is not manifest with each person, then the connection is not tenable.

original: mtshams sbyor ba ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What kind of connection is it?

original: don gcig la mngon par zhen pa'i bdag nyid gang la mod pa'i mtshams sbyor ba de la de skad ces brjod @135b do //
analyzed: don gcig la mngon par zhen pa'i bdag nyid gang la mod pa'i mtshams sbyor ba de la de skad ces brjod @135b do //
translated: It is called a connection when there is a single object that is the nature of adherence.

original: gang dag mtshams sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag mtshams sbyor zhe na /
translated: What is connected?

original: smra ba bo dang nyan pa po de dag gi sems te /
analyzed: smra ba bo dang nyan pa po de dag gi sems te /
translated: The minds of the speaker and the hearer.

original: de dag tha dad ba'i rnam pa 'dzin pa la 'jug pa'i phyir mtshams sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag tha dad ba'i rnam pa 'dzin pa la 'jug pa'i phyir mtshams sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not become connected because they engage in apprehending different aspects.

original: gnyi ga der snang can min bar //
analyzed: gnyi ga der snang can min bar //
translated: If you say that both are not seen as such,

original: 'dra phyir tha snyad gcig ce na //
analyzed: 'dra phyir tha snyad gcig ce na //
translated: because they appear similarly, they are the same.

original: tha dad dngos don ji ltar gzung//
analyzed: tha dad dngos don ji ltar gzung//
translated: How can one apprehend a different thing?

original: do tshe blo don can mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: do tshe blo don can mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The cognition would not be of the object.

original: 'on te bdag dang gzhan gyi rtogs pa dag gcig pa nyid du snang ba ste 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhen /
analyzed: 'on te bdag dang gzhan gyi rtogs pa dag gcig pa nyid du snang ba ste 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhen /
translated: If you say that the cognition of self and other is the same because it appears to be the same,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: mngon pa dag ni tha dad pa'i dngos bor rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon pa dag ni tha dad pa'i dngos bor rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: The Abhidharma masters apprehend things as different.

original: gzhan gyi mthong ba mi mthong zhing rnag nyid kyis khong du chud pa gzhan gyis mi mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi mthong ba mi mthong zhing rnag nyid kyis khong du chud pa gzhan gyis mi mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: The one who sees pus does not see the other‚Äôs perception, and the one who understands pus does not see the other‚Äôs perception.

original: phan tshul tha dad pa'i don 'dzin pa ji ltar 'dra ba nyid du snang ba yin /
analyzed: phan tshul tha dad pa'i don 'dzin pa ji ltar 'dra ba nyid du snang ba yin /
translated: How can the apprehension of mutually different objects appear to be the same?

original: khas blangs nas kyang 'dra bar brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: khas blangs nas kyang 'dra bar brjod par bya ste /
translated: Even if you accept that, you should say that they are the same.

original: smra ba bo dang nyan pa po'i sems de dag tha dad pa'i don snang ba dang bral ba can tha dad pa'i bdag nyid kyi don ji ltar gzung ba yin te ma yin no //
analyzed: smra ba bo dang nyan pa po'i sems de dag tha dad pa'i don snang ba dang bral ba can tha dad pa'i bdag nyid kyi don ji ltar gzung ba yin te ma yin no //
translated: How can the minds of the speaker and the hearer, which are devoid of the appearance of different objects, apprehend an object that has a different nature? They cannot.

original: rtogs par ma gyur pa ni gzung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rtogs par ma gyur pa ni gzung ba ma yin te /
translated: That which is not perceived is not apprehended,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to an absurd consequence.

original: gzhan yang gang gi tshe mi bden par rjod par byed pa de'i tshe don med na ni ci ltar shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi tshe mi bden par rjod par byed pa de'i tshe don med na ni ci ltar shes par 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, when one speaks of what is not real, if there is no object, how can there be cognition?

original: 'on te don med par yang 'gyur na ;
analyzed: 'on te don med par yang 'gyur na ;
translated: But if there is no object,

original: 'o na ni de'i tshe blo don med pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i tshe blo don med pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time cognition would be without an object,

original: 'di ltar mi bden pa'i don la don gyi rnam pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi bden pa'i don la don gyi rnam pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because a non-real object does not have the aspect of an object.

original: rnam pa 'di dag ni shes pa nyid yin pas rnam par shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag ni shes pa nyid yin pas rnam par shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par grub pa yin no //
translated: Since these aspects are cognition itself, it is established that consciousness has aspects.

original: slob dpon gyis kyang rnam pa dang bcas par shes pa sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang rnam pa dang bcas par shes pa sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: The Master [DignƒÅga] also states, in order to prove that cognition has aspects:

original: yul shes de yi shes pa yis //
analyzed: yul shes de yi shes pa yis //
translated: The object and the cognition of that

original: tha dad phyir tshul gnyis can nyid //üîΩces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: tha dad phyir tshul gnyis can nyid // ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: are different, because they have two modes.

original: yul ni gzugs la sogs ba ste //
analyzed: yul ni gzugs la sogs ba ste //
translated: The object is form and so on.

original: shes pa gang zhig don de dang rang snang ba can te /
analyzed: shes pa gang zhig don de dang rang snang ba can te /
translated: The cognition is that which appears as that object.

original: yul gyi shes pa'i shes ba gang yin pa de don dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes pa snang ba dang rang snad ba yin no //
analyzed: yul gyi shes pa'i shes ba gang yin pa de don dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes pa snang ba dang rang snad ba yin no //
translated: The consciousness of the object is the consciousness that is in accordance with the object, and it is the appearance of the object and the appearance of itself.

original: de lta ma yin nag la ce yul gyi shes pa don gyi rnam pa can nyid du gyur pa dang / rang gi rnam pa can nyid dum gyur na ni /üîΩyul shes kyi shes pa yang de dang khyad @136a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin nag la ce yul gyi shes pa don gyi rnam pa can nyid du gyur pa dang / rang gi rnam pa can nyid dum gyur na ni / yul shes kyi shes pa yang de dang khyad @136a * //
translated: If it were not so, then the consciousness of the object would not be in the aspect of the object, and it would not be in its own aspect.

original: par med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then there would be no difference between the consciousness of the object and the consciousness of that consciousness.

original: yul gyi shes pa gang yin pa de ni don snang ba can dang rang snang ba nyid du bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: yul gyi shes pa gang yin pa de ni don snang ba can dang rang snang ba nyid du bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: The consciousness of the object is to be established as having the appearance of the object and the appearance of itself,

original: yul gyi shes pa dang de'i shes pa tha dad pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yul gyi shes pa dang de'i shes pa tha dad pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because the consciousness of the object and the consciousness of that are different.

original: gtan tshigs yin la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs yin la /
translated: This is the reason.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: If it were not so, etc. is the refutation.

original: de nyid 'dir rnam 'grel mdzad pas bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid 'dir rnam 'grel mdzad pas bshad pa /
translated: This very point is explained by the author of the Pramii(laviirttikam) as follows:

original: nyams myong rnam shes de yang ni //
analyzed: nyams myong rnam shes de yang ni //
translated: That experience-consciousness

original: cha gnyis dmigs pa can gyi ni //
analyzed: cha gnyis dmigs pa can gyi ni //
translated: is the possessor of the apprehension of two parts.

original: rnam pa gcig gi khyad par can //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig gi khyad par can //

original: shes pa de yis rjes 'brel byed //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: shes pa de yis rjes 'brel byed // ces bya ba la /
translated: That consciousness is associated with it.

original: nyams su myong ba'i shes pa sngon sngon po la sogs pa'i yul can de gnyis pa nyams su myong ba 'dzin pa'i shes pa dran pa'i rang bzhin can gyis rjes su 'brel bar byed pa ste yul du byed cing /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i shes pa sngon sngon po la sogs pa'i yul can de gnyis pa nyams su myong ba 'dzin pa'i shes pa dran pa'i rang bzhin can gyis rjes su 'brel bar byed pa ste yul du byed cing /
translated: With regard to the first line, ‚Äúthe consciousness that experiences the object blue,‚Äù the consciousness that experiences the object blue in the past is associated with the consciousness that apprehends the experience of the object blue in the present, which has the nature of memory. It is associated with it in the sense that it is its object.

original: rtogs par byed pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is synonymous with ‚Äúit is realized.‚Äù

original: ji lta bur gyur pas she na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pas she na /
translated: In what way?

original: sngon po dang rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gnyis kyi cha dmigs pa'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: sngon po dang rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gnyis kyi cha dmigs pa'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That which has the mode of observing the two aspects, the nature of blue and the nature of its realization, is said to be ‚Äúassociated with the special feature of one aspect.‚Äù

original: de lta bur gyur pas sngon por snang ba yod pa'o zhes zhen pa'i rnam pas dmigs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pas sngon por snang ba yod pa'o zhes zhen pa'i rnam pas dmigs par 'gyur la /
translated: In that way, it is associated with the aspect that conceives of the existence of the appearance of blue.

original: rnam pa gcig gi khyad par can ni rnam pa gcig gis lhag pas yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig gi khyad par can ni rnam pa gcig gis lhag pas yin no //
translated: It is associated with the special feature of one aspect because it is distinguished by one aspect.

original: 'on te don gyis go bas 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i shes pa rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te don gyis go bas 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i shes pa rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is understood by implication, then the consciousness of the past and the present are realized.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: de lta bu'i rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no such cognition.

original: gang gis don gyis go ba de yis shes pa rang la yod do zhes pa de ltar 'jig rten na rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis don gyis go ba de yis shes pa rang la yod do zhes pa de ltar 'jig rten na rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in the world there is no cognition of the sort that ‚ÄúI know that cognition exists in myself‚Äù through the understanding of the object.

original: gzugs la sogs pa snang ba las tha dad pa'i blo la don gyis go ba'am mngon sum gyis dpyad par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa snang ba las tha dad pa'i blo la don gyis go ba'am mngon sum gyis dpyad par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible to analyze the cognition that is different from the appearance of form, etc., either through the understanding of the object or through perception.

original: 'on te rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid sngon po la sogs pa tha dad pa tha dad pa nyid du brtag par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid sngon po la sogs pa tha dad pa tha dad pa nyid du brtag par bya'o zhe na /

original: rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid de yang mi shes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid de yang mi shes pa ma yin nam /

analyzed: tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyang rjes su 'gro ba ldog pa dag las med pa kho na yin te //
translated: The convention of difference is also only from going and coming.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag snga ma dang phyi mar 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag snga ma dang phyi mar 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because going and coming occur in sequence.

original: snga phyi yang mngon sum ma yin te de nye ba cam 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga phyi yang mngon sum ma yin te de nye ba cam 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sequence is not direct perception, because it grasps only what is near.

original: de med par yang rjes su dpag pa yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de med par yang rjes su dpag pa yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: And without that, there is no inference.

original: dus la sogs pa tha dad pa yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: dus la sogs pa tha dad pa yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, time, etc. are not different.

original: nye bar bsdu ba smras pa /
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba smras pa /
translated: The summary is stated:

original: de phyir shes dus snang ba can //
analyzed: de phyir shes dus snang ba can //
translated: Therefore, cognition appears at the time of the object.

original: don ni shes las tha dad nyid //
analyzed: don ni shes las tha dad nyid //
translated: The object is not different from cognition.

original: bzlog par shin tu dka' ba yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzlog par shin tu dka' ba yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is very difficult to reverse.

original: shes pa'i dus na snang ba'i don ni tha mi dad par grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa'i dus na snang ba'i don ni tha mi dad par grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir /
translated: With respect to that, since the object that appears at the time of consciousness is not different and is established as the same entity as consciousness,

original: shes pa las tha dad pa mad pa bzlog par dka' ba ste bzlog bar mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa las tha dad pa mad pa bzlog par dka' ba ste bzlog bar mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: it is very difficult to reverse the nondifference from consciousness, because it is impossible to reverse it.

original: shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is established that consciousness has aspects.

original: gal te rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa yin na /
translated: If consciousness has aspects,

original: 'o na ni shes pa nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can du snang bar 'gyur te don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni shes pa nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can du snang bar 'gyur te don ni ma yin no //
translated: then consciousness itself would appear as the aspect of blue and so on, but the object would not.

original: de mthong na yang don gzhan bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de mthong na yang don gzhan bar 'gyur la /
translated: If that were seen, then the object would be different.

original: don de shes pa'i dus na snang na ni slar shes pa las tha mi dad pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de shes pa'i dus na snang na ni slar shes pa las tha mi dad pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If the object were to appear at the time of the consciousness of that object, then it would not be different from consciousness.

original: rnam pa gzhan la ltos pa yang don gzhan la ltos par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan la ltos pa yang don gzhan la ltos par 'gyur bas /
translated: Since it would rely on another aspect, it would rely on another object,

original: thug pa med par 'gyur bas mi rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: thug pa med par 'gyur bas mi rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: and since there would be an infinite regress, it would not be cognized.

original: 'dir lan smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir lan smras pa /
translated: Here the reply is this.

original: rgyu yi tha dad dpog par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu yi tha dad dpog par 'gyur //
translated: The difference in the cause will be inferred.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:üîΩBecause of the perception of consciousness

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: That has the aspect of blue, etc.,

original: rgyu'i tha dad pa ste /üîΩrgya'i khyad par dpog par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rgyu'i tha dad pa ste / rgya'i khyad par dpog par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The difference in the cause

original: don du mngon bar mthong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don du mngon bar mthong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Will be inferred, but not the object.

original: ji skad brjod pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad brjod pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the previously mentioned error will occur.üîΩBut in this case, the object is not perceived at all.

original: 'o na 'di ltar shin tu mi snang ba'i don dpog par byed de /
analyzed: 'o na 'di ltar shin tu mi snang ba'i don dpog par byed de /
translated: How can you infer it?

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He says:

original: rgyu gzhan dag ni yod gyur kyang //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan dag ni yod gyur kyang //
translated: Even though other causes exist,üîΩThe mental consciousness does not arise

original: dbang po'i blo rnams med pa'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang po'i blo rnams med pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because the sense consciousnesses do not exist.

original: don las gzhan pa'i rgyu mig dang yid la byed pa dang snang ba dag yod par gyur kyang /
analyzed: don las gzhan pa'i rgyu mig dang yid la byed pa dang snang ba dag yod par gyur kyang /
translated: Even though the causes of the mental consciousness other than the object‚Äîthe eye, attention, and light‚Äîexist, the mental consciousness does not arise because the sense consciousnesses do not exist.

original: res 'ga' ka bas stong ba'i sa phyogs su mngon par 'dod kyang ka ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi dbang po'i blo rnams med @140b ba'i phyir dang / gzhan du ni yod pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i rgyu'i khyad par dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ka bas stong ba'i sa phyogs su mngon par 'dod kyang ka ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi dbang po'i blo rnams med @140b ba'i phyir dang / gzhan du ni yod pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i rgyu'i khyad par dpag par bya'o //
translated: Sometimes, even though one desires the place empty of a pillar, the sense consciousness that has the aspect of a pillar, etc. does not exist, and elsewhere it does exist. Therefore, one should infer a special cause different from the eye, etc.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba'i khyad par dang bral ba'i don kho na gzhal bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba'i khyad par dang bral ba'i don kho na gzhal bar bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the object alone, which is free from the special seeing, is the object to be cognized.

original: 'o na ji ltar mngon sum gyis gzung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar mngon sum gyis gzung ba yin zhe na /
translated: Well, how is it apprehended by direct perception?

original: de'i rnam par shes pa la gnas pa mngon sum yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pa la gnas pa mngon sum yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because its consciousness is present, it is direct perception.

original: don mngon sum gyi yul yin par brjod do //
analyzed: don mngon sum gyi yul yin par brjod do //
translated: The object is said to be the object of direct perception.

original: de lta na phyi rol gyi don nyid gzhal bar bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta na phyi rol gyi don nyid gzhal bar bya ba yin gyi /
translated: In that case, is it not the case that the external object alone is the object to be cognized,

original: shes pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa ma yin pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa ma yin pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: and that this statement, ‚ÄúIt is consciousness only,‚Äù is not tenable?

original: smras pa / gal te mtshungs pa de ma thag / rkyen las nges par mi smra na'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gal te mtshungs pa de ma thag / rkyen las nges par mi smra na'o //
translated: We say: If one does not speak of ascertainment from the condition of the immediately preceding similar one,

original: zhes pa ste ;
analyzed: zhes pa ste ;
translated: then it is so.

original: gal te dbang bo'i blo rnams mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las /
analyzed: gal te dbang bo'i blo rnams mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las /
translated: If the mental consciousness is the immediately preceding condition of the sense consciousnesses,üîΩ

original: yul dang dus dang rnam par nges par rnam par shes pa tsam smra ba rnams mi smra na /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rnam par nges par rnam par shes pa tsam smra ba rnams mi smra na /
translated: If those who advocate consciousness only do not say that the consciousness that is determined in terms of object, time, and aspect arises from a similar immediately preceding condition,

original: de'i tshe rgyu tha dad par dpog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyu tha dad par dpog par 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time it would be inferred that it has a different cause.

original: gang gi tshe sngar mthong bas gzhag pa'i bag chags kyi stobs nyid las rnam par skye ba des shin tu ma mthong ba'i phyi rol par rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sngar mthong bas gzhag pa'i bag chags kyi stobs nyid las rnam par skye ba des shin tu ma mthong ba'i phyi rol par rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: When it arises from the power of the latent potentialities that are deposited by seeing, it is not understood to be an external object that is not seen.

original: mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rtogs pa de ji ltar ma mthong ba'i don la 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rtogs pa de ji ltar ma mthong ba'i don la 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: How could the understanding that follows seeing engage objects that are not seen?

original: 'o na phyi rol gyi don med par rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang shes par bya ba dang / shes par byed pa'i dngos por ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na phyi rol gyi don med par rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang shes par bya ba dang / shes par byed pa'i dngos por ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: If external objects do not exist, how could there be a causal relationship between objects and consciousnesses or a relationship between the known and the knower?

original: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don med na blo rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos bor gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don med na blo rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos bor gzhag par bya ste /
translated: Thus, if external objects do not exist, the relationship between objects and consciousnesses is posited as a causal relationship.

original: sa bon snang ba can gyi shes pa'i rjes thogs su res 'ga' myu gur snang ba can gyi shes pa yod kyang res 'ga' sa bon du snang ba cad kyi shes pa med par yang myu gur snang ba'i shes pa yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sa bon snang ba can gyi shes pa'i rjes thogs su res 'ga' myu gur snang ba can gyi shes pa yod kyang res 'ga' sa bon du snang ba cad kyi shes pa med par yang myu gur snang ba'i shes pa yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Sometimes, immediately after a consciousness that appears as a seed, there is a consciousness that appears as a sprout, but sometimes there is a consciousness that appears as a sprout even though there is no consciousness that appears as a seed.

original: des na ji ltar sa bon dang myug gu la sogs pa dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos phyi rol gyi don du smra ba la nim rtogs par gyur kyang rang gi rgyu yod de de ni myu gu'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: des na ji ltar sa bon dang myug gu la sogs pa dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos phyi rol gyi don du smra ba la nim rtogs par gyur kyang rang gi rgyu yod de de ni myu gu'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, how could it be that, in the case of seeds and sprouts, etc.,

original: sa bon shes pa ni ma rtogs par gyur na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sa bon shes pa ni ma rtogs par gyur na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: the consciousness that is the seed does not exist when the consciousness that is the sprout has not yet arisen.

original: des nas bon gyi shes pa'i rjes thogs su myu gu'i shes pa 'byung zhing myu gu'i shes pa'i rjes thogs su sa bon gyi shes pa 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des nas bon gyi shes pa'i rjes thogs su myu gu'i shes pa 'byung zhing myu gu'i shes pa'i rjes thogs su sa bon gyi shes pa 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, immediately after the consciousness that is the seed, the consciousness that is the sprout arises, and immediately after the consciousness that is the sprout, the consciousness that is the seed arises.

original: phan tshun rgyu can nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun rgyu can nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they would not be mutually caused.

original: des na shes par bya ba dang shes par byed pa'i dngos po yang ring du spangs pa yin te @141a * //
analyzed: des na shes par bya ba dang shes par byed pa'i dngos po yang ring du spangs pa yin te @141a * //
translated: Therefore, the entities that are the objects of knowledge and the knower are also completely abandoned.

original: du ba las me yod par sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po lkog tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: du ba las me yod par sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po lkog tu gyur pa ste /
translated: The entity that proves the existence of fire from smoke is hidden.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i phyi rol ba yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i phyi rol ba yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The existence of the hidden external object does not exist.

original: mer snang ba yang shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mer snang ba yang shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The appearance as fire is also the nature of consciousness,

original: lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa kho na yin la /
translated: and therefore it is not hidden at all.

original: phyi rol la ni lkog tu gyur pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol la ni lkog tu gyur pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But the external object is not hidden.

original: de bas na de rjes su dpag par rigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de rjes su dpag par rigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to infer it.

original: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba nyid rigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba nyid rigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to advocate external objects.üîΩIn response, it is said:üîΩThe seed produces the sprout,

original: smras pa / sa bon las myu gu skyed dang // du ba las me grub po zhes //
analyzed: smras pa / sa bon las myu gu skyed dang // du ba las me grub po zhes //
translated: and smoke proves the existence of fire.

original: de 'dra phyi rol don rten can //
analyzed: de 'dra phyi rol don rten can //
translated: Such things are based on external objects.üîΩThe one who abides in wisdom

original: byed por shes rab gnas pa gang //üîΩde yang de'i ngo bor snang can //
analyzed: byed por shes rab gnas pa gang // de yang de'i ngo bor snang can //
translated: is the agent.üîΩIf that is the appearance of its nature,

original: yin na de bzhin nges skye can //
analyzed: yin na de bzhin nges skye can //
translated: then it is the same as the one who is born.

original: blo rten pas ni ldog byed na //
analyzed: blo rten pas ni ldog byed na //
translated: If the mind is supported, it will stop.üîΩ

original: 'gal ba dag ni ci zhig yod //
analyzed: 'gal ba dag ni ci zhig yod //
translated: If the mind is based on that, what contradiction is there in its being reversed?

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: In this regard,

original: sa bon la myu gu skye ba'o zhes bya ba de 'dra ba ni phyi rol gyi don la brten pa can gyi byed pa por gnas pa dang / du ba las me sgrub po zhes bya ba de lta bu phyir rol gyi don la brten pa can gyi shes par byed par gnas pa gang yin pa de yod do //
analyzed: sa bon la myu gu skye ba'o zhes bya ba de 'dra ba ni phyi rol gyi don la brten pa can gyi byed pa por gnas pa dang / du ba las me sgrub po zhes bya ba de lta bu phyir rol gyi don la brten pa can gyi shes par byed par gnas pa gang yin pa de yod do //
translated: there is a basis for the activity of the seed in relation to the sprout, as in the statement, ‚ÄúThe sprout arises from the seed,‚Äù and there is a basis for the cognition of fire in relation to smoke, as in the statement, ‚ÄúFire is inferred from smoke.‚Äù

original: gnas pa de gnyi ga yang phyi rol gyi don la ma ltos par de'i ngo bor snang ba can de sa bon dang myu gu la sogs par snang ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa de gnyi ga yang phyi rol gyi don la ma ltos par de'i ngo bor snang ba can de sa bon dang myu gu la sogs par snang ba'o //
translated: Both of these bases are not dependent on external objects, and they appear as if they were of the nature of those [objects], as in the appearance of the seed and the sprout.

original: de bzhin du sa bon la sogs par snang du rung ba'i rjes la nges pa skye ru rung ba gang la yod pa'i myu gu la sogs pa'i blo rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa bon la sogs par snang du rung ba'i rjes la nges pa skye ru rung ba gang la yod pa'i myu gu la sogs pa'i blo rnams so //
translated: Similarly, the cognitions of the sprout, etc., are capable of arising after the appearance of the seed, etc., and they are capable of producing ascertainment.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i blo la brten nam gal te rtog par byed na ni 'gal ba ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i blo la brten nam gal te rtog par byed na ni 'gal ba ci zhig yod de /
translated: If the mind is based on such a cognition or if it conceives of it, what contradiction is there?

original: ci yang med do //
analyzed: ci yang med do //
translated: There is none at all.

original: de'i dgongs ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i dgongs ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: rgyu 'bras ni shes pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu 'bras ni shes pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: Cause and effect are consciousness itself,

original: don ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don ni ma yin te /
translated: not objects.

original: ma mthong ba'i don yod kyang med pa dang bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i don yod kyang med pa dang bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even though an object that is not seen exists, it is no different from what does not exist.

original: de skad du yang yod pa ni dmigs pa la brjod de /
analyzed: de skad du yang yod pa ni dmigs pa la brjod de /
translated: Thus it is said, ‚ÄúExistence is said to be the object of perception.

original: med pa'i med pa zhes bya ba ni ma dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: med pa'i med pa zhes bya ba ni ma dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Nonexistence is said to be nonexistence because it is not perceived.‚Äù

original: 'on te snang ba nyid phyi rol pa med par yod par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te snang ba nyid phyi rol pa med par yod par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how could an appearance exist without an external object?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: don med kyang snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan zin to ;
analyzed: don med kyang snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan zin to ;
translated: It has already been explained that an appearance can occur even without an object.

original: / de'i phyir sa bon mthong ba las myu gu mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / de'i phyir sa bon mthong ba las myu gu mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because a sprout is seen from seeing a seed,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not logical that they are cause and effect.

original: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang sa bon mthong ba 'ba' zhig las ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang sa bon mthong ba 'ba' zhig las ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: But still, it is not the case that a sprout arises from seeing a seed alone.

original: gal te sa bon du snang ba med par myu gu yang mthong bas de'i tshe sa bon med na @141b myu gu yang rgyu med par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on te sa bon snang ba can gzhan de la yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te sa bon du snang ba med par myu gu yang mthong bas de'i tshe sa bon med na @141b myu gu yang rgyu med par 'gyur ro // 'on te sa bon snang ba can gzhan de la yod pa'i phyir /
translated: If the sprout is seen without the appearance of the seed, then at that time, since the seed does not exist, the sprout would be without a cause.

original: myu gu rgyu med pa can ma yin no zer na /
analyzed: myu gu rgyu med pa can ma yin no zer na /
translated: But if you say that the sprout is not without a cause because the seed that has the appearance of the seed exists,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so.

original: nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgdon mi za bar sa bon mthong ba gzhan yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i phyir ro // gdon mi za bar sa bon mthong ba gzhan yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Because there is no certainty.

original: gzhan mthong ba'i bdag nyid las myu gu mthong ba 'byung ba ma yin no //üîΩphyi rol du smra ba rnams la ni myu gu rgyu med pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan mthong ba'i bdag nyid las myu gu mthong ba 'byung ba ma yin no // phyi rol du smra ba rnams la ni myu gu rgyu med pa can ma yin te /
translated: Without a doubt, the seed that is seen does not exist, and the sprout that is seen does not arise from the nature of the seed that is seen.

original: ma mthong ba'i sa bon rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i sa bon rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: For the proponents of external objects, the sprout is not without a cause because the unseen seed is the cause.

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: That is not tenable.

original: 'di ltar gal te sa bon gang gis kyang mthong ba'i yul du ma gyur pa yod do snyam pa de'i tshe de yod pa la tshad ma ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te sa bon gang gis kyang mthong ba'i yul du ma gyur pa yod do snyam pa de'i tshe de yod pa la tshad ma ci zhig yod de /
translated: Thus, if you think that the seed that is not seen at all exists, then at that time what is the valid knowledge of its existence?

original: gang gis myu gu sa bon gyi rgyu can du grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis myu gu sa bon gyi rgyu can du grub par 'gyur /
translated: How could the sprout be established as having a seed as its cause?

original: nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid can ni dngos po med na yin par brjod do //
analyzed: nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid can ni dngos po med na yin par brjod do //
translated: If it is devoid of all abilities, it is said to be a non-thing.

original: 'on te 'bras bu mthong ba las yod par nges par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu mthong ba las yod par nges par byed do zhe na /
translated: But if you determine that it exists through seeing the effect,

original: 'on 'bras bu de nyid yod par ma grub na ji ltar 'bras bur shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on 'bras bu de nyid yod par ma grub na ji ltar 'bras bur shes par 'gyur te /
translated: then if the effect itself is not established as existing, how could it be known as an effect?

original: sa bon yod par grub na ni myu gu de'i 'bras bur grub bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sa bon yod par grub na ni myu gu de'i 'bras bur grub bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: If the seed is established as existing, then the sprout is established as its effect.

original: 'bras bu nyid du myu gu grub na ni sa bon yod par 'grub pa'i phyir gcig la gcig brten pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid du myu gu grub na ni sa bon yod par 'grub pa'i phyir gcig la gcig brten pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if the sprout is established as the effect, then the seed is established as existing. Thus the error of mutual dependence would ensue.

original: 'on te sngar mthong ba'i sa bon gzhan gyis mthong ba dang dus gzhan dang 'brel ba can la gcig tu sgro btags nas gcig tu mthong ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sngar mthong ba'i sa bon gzhan gyis mthong ba dang dus gzhan dang 'brel ba can la gcig tu sgro btags nas gcig tu mthong ba yin no zhe na /

original: rang dang gzhan gyi shes pa dag gis sgro 'dogs par byed kyang gang gis 'gog par byed de /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi shes pa dag gis sgro 'dogs par byed kyang gang gis 'gog par byed de /
translated: then even though your own and others‚Äô consciousnesses superimpose identity, what would refute that?

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i shes pa la yang gcig tu zhen pa yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i shes pa la yang gcig tu zhen pa yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that there is a single conceptual consciousness that conceives the prior and subsequent moments to be the same?

original: 'on te myu gu snang ba'i tshe sa bon mthong ba med na de ji ltar de la sgro 'dogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te myu gu snang ba'i tshe sa bon mthong ba med na de ji ltar de la sgro 'dogs par 'gyur zhe na /

original: 'o na phyi rol gyi sa bon de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'o na phyi rol gyi sa bon de'i tshe /
translated: In that case, when the external seed is not seen,

analyzed: ma mthong bar phyi rol yang sgro btags nas yod par sgro 'dogs pa de bzhin du shes pa yang yin no //

original: de ltar na gal te de la skyes bu gang zhig me snang du rung bar rjes su dpog ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar na gal te de la skyes bu gang zhig me snang du rung bar rjes su dpog ba de'i tshe /
translated: In that case, if someone infers that a fire exists because smoke is seen,

original: phyi rol du sgro 'dogs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du gal te 'dir yang rung ba yod na mer snang bar 'gyur ro //üîΩde bas na sgro btags pa las snang ba @142a * //
analyzed: phyi rol du sgro 'dogs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du gal te 'dir yang rung ba yod na mer snang bar 'gyur ro // de bas na sgro btags pa las snang ba @142a * //
translated: then just as the external seed is superimposed, so too the fire would be superimposed.

original: yod pa yin no //üîΩgzhan yang zla ba gnyis su snang ba bzhin du thams cad du gcig tu tha snyad 'dogs pa tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: yod pa yin no // gzhan yang zla ba gnyis su snang ba bzhin du thams cad du gcig tu tha snyad 'dogs pa tsam yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the appearance exists due to superimposition.üîΩMoreover, just as the appearance of two moons is a mere convention, not reality,

original: yang dag par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par ni ma yin no //
translated: so too is everything else.

original: de'i phyir de la 'bad par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la 'bad par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not necessary to exert oneself in that.

original: du ba mes bskyed mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: du ba mes bskyed mi 'gyur te //
translated: Smoke is not generated by fire,üîΩand therefore,

original: de phyir 'bras las rgyu rtogs par //
analyzed: de phyir 'bras las rgyu rtogs par //
translated: from the effect, the cause is not understood.

original: mi 'gyur rgyu nyid yin na yang //üîΩgang las nges par rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: mi 'gyur rgyu nyid yin na yang // gang las nges par rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: Even if it is the cause,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: from what is it ascertained?

original: gal te rnam par shes pas smra ba dag snang ba thams cad bag chags dang 'brel ba nyid yin no /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pas smra ba dag snang ba thams cad bag chags dang 'brel ba nyid yin no /

original: de lta na ni du ba mes bskyed pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni du ba mes bskyed pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: then smoke would not be generated by fire,

original: rang gi bag chags tsam dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi bag chags tsam dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be related to its own latent potentialities alone.

original: de'i phyir du ba mes ma bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir du ba mes ma bskyed pa'i phyir /

original: 'bras bu las rgyu me rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bu las rgyu me rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: from the effect, the cause, fire, is not understood.

original: 'on te du bar snang ba snga la mer snang ba 'phyi bas du ba rgyu yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te du bar snang ba snga la mer snang ba 'phyi bas du ba rgyu yin no snyam na /
translated: But if the appearance of smoke occurs earlier and the appearance of fire occurs later, then smoke is the cause.

original: de lta na ni du ba rgyur gyur pa nges par me rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ni du ba rgyur gyur pa nges par me rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is the case, then the smoke that is the cause is not ascertained as fire.

original: de la lan btab pa /
analyzed: de la lan btab pa /
translated: The response to that is:

original: de la 'ang du bar snang ba'i blo //
analyzed: de la 'ang du bar snang ba'i blo //
translated: Even in that case, the cognition of smoke

original: bag chags gsal bar sad pa can //üîΩmer snang ba yi blo nyid ni //
analyzed: bag chags gsal bar sad pa can // mer snang ba yi blo nyid ni //
translated: The cognition that appears as fire

original: rtogs 'gyur me ni ma yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtogs 'gyur me ni ma yin no // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is understood by the cognition that appears as smoke.

original: me du bas rjes su dpog pa de la yang du bar snang ba'i blo nyid kyis mer snang ba'i blo nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me du bas rjes su dpog pa de la yang du bar snang ba'i blo nyid kyis mer snang ba'i blo nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of inferring fire from smoke, the cognition that appears as smoke understands the cognition that appears as fire.

original: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: How is that?

original: blo gang la bag chags gsal bar sad pa yod pa de yin no //
analyzed: blo gang la bag chags gsal bar sad pa yod pa de yin no //

original: de dag gis ni 'di skad du ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'di skad du ston par 'gyur te /
translated: They teach this by saying:

original: du bar snang ba'i blo ni mer snang ba'i shes pa dang 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: du bar snang ba'i blo ni mer snang ba'i shes pa dang 'brel pa yin te /
translated: The cognition that appears as smoke is related to the cognition that appears as fire,

original: bag chags de rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: bag chags de rtogs par byed do //

original: me'i bag chags de yang sad pa la mngon du phyogs bar gyur nas mer snang ba bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: me'i bag chags de yang sad pa la mngon du phyogs bar gyur nas mer snang ba bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, the latent potentialities of fire, having been awakened, become manifest, and they generate the appearance of fire.

original: mer snang ba'i tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: mer snang ba'i tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the appearance of fire is a valid cognition.

original: dper na phyi rol gyi me dpags na me'i shes pa dang / me gzhan skyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na phyi rol gyi me dpags na me'i shes pa dang / me gzhan skyed pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, when one infers external fire, the cognition of fire and the generation of another fire

analyzed: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pas me thob par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as fire is obtained in dependence on a collection,

analyzed: du ba dang me'i shes par snang ba dag bag chags gcig la rag las pa yin no //
translated: so the appearance of the cognition of smoke and fire is in dependence on a single latent impression.

original: don du gnyer ba ni mer @142b snang ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: don du gnyer ba ni mer @142b snang ba nyid yin te /

original: de bas na phyi rol gyi don med pa la mer snang ba la ltos nas rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na phyi rol gyi don med pa la mer snang ba la ltos nas rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the absence of an external object, the appearance as fire is a valid cognition of inference.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i snang ba ji ltar rjes su dpag pa zhes bya zha na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i snang ba ji ltar rjes su dpag pa zhes bya zha na /
translated: How can the appearance of the future be called inference?

original: de lta bu nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is seen to be just like that inference.

original: phyi rol gyi don la ni rmi lam gyis ma nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don la ni rmi lam gyis ma nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: But in the case of external objects, it would be uncertain in dreams.

original: zhes bstan te mthong ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'o na gal te du ba la sogs par snang ba bag chags las skyes ba nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: zhes bstan te mthong ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro // 'o na gal te du ba la sogs par snang ba bag chags las skyes ba nyid yin zhing /
translated: This is taught because there is no seeing at all.üîΩNow, if the appearance as smoke and so on arises from latent impressions,

original: de yang rigs mtshungs pa'i bag chags kyi sbrul ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs mtshungs pa'i bag chags kyi sbrul ba nyid yin te /
translated: and that arises from the manifestation of latent impressions of a similar type,

original: da'i phyir du bar snang ba las du ba'i bag chags nyid go bar byed kyi /
analyzed: da'i phyir du bar snang ba las du ba'i bag chags nyid go bar byed kyi /
translated: Therefore, the latent impression of smoke is what causes understanding, not the latent impression of fire.

original: ji ltar me'i bag chags go bar byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar me'i bag chags go bar byed de /
translated: How does the latent impression of fire cause understanding?

original: 'di ltar ngo bo gang zhig mthong bas byas pa'i bag chags ni ngo bo nyid mthong ba'i rgyur 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar ngo bo gang zhig mthong bas byas pa'i bag chags ni ngo bo nyid mthong ba'i rgyur 'gyur gyi /
translated: In this way, the latent impression that is produced by seeing a specific thing becomes the cause for seeing that specific thing.

original: du bar snang ba las me'i bag chags skyes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: du bar snang ba las me'i bag chags skyes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the latent impression of fire is not produced from the appearance of smoke.

original: des na ji ltar dus phyis snang ba'i du bar snang ba skyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na ji ltar dus phyis snang ba'i du bar snang ba skyed par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could it later produce the appearance of smoke?

original: de'i phyir du bar snang ba ni du ba'i bag chags las skyes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir du bar snang ba ni du ba'i bag chags las skyes pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the appearance of smoke is produced from the latent impression of smoke.

original: me'i bag chags dang mer snang ba las ma skyes pas go bar byed pa ma yin no zhen /
analyzed: me'i bag chags dang mer snang ba las ma skyes pas go bar byed pa ma yin no zhen /
translated: It is not produced from the appearance of fire or the latent impression of fire. Therefore, it is not what causes understanding.

original: smras pa / de rung bag chags snying po can //
analyzed: smras pa / de rung bag chags snying po can //
translated: In response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:üîΩThat is suitable, the latent impression of the essence

original: du bar snang can blo yi ni //
analyzed: du bar snang can blo yi ni //
translated: Of the cognition that possesses the appearance of smoke

original: sems rgyud gsal bar byed pa yin //
analyzed: sems rgyud gsal bar byed pa yin //
translated: Is what causes the continuum of mind to be clear.

original: de phyir me las du ba skyes //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de phyir me las du ba skyes //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore smoke arises from fire.

original: mer snang ba skye ba de'i rung ba me'i bag chags gang yin pa de ni snying po can te de dang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: mer snang ba skye ba de'i rung ba me'i bag chags gang yin pa de ni snying po can te de dang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: The ‚Äúessence‚Äù of the cognition of fire is the latent impression of fire, and it is endowed with that.

original: du ba'i bag chags can gyi sems kyi rgyud sngon du song ba'i du bar snang ba can gyi blo gsal bar byed pa ste skyed par byed do //
analyzed: du ba'i bag chags can gyi sems kyi rgyud sngon du song ba'i du bar snang ba can gyi blo gsal bar byed pa ste skyed par byed do //
translated: The cognition of smoke is produced, i.e., made manifest, by the mental continuum that possesses the latent impression of smoke.

original: de'i phyir du ba'i bag chags du bar snang ba'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir du ba'i bag chags du bar snang ba'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Therefore, the latent impression of smoke is the material cause of the appearance of smoke,

original: me'i bag chags ni lhan cig byed pa'i grogs byed pa'o //
analyzed: me'i bag chags ni lhan cig byed pa'i grogs byed pa'o //
translated: and the latent impression of fire is the cooperative condition.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i mer snang ba'i ni mer snang ba nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i mer snang ba'i ni mer snang ba nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: The latent impression of future fire is the material cause of the appearance of fire,

original: du ba'i bag chags ni grogs byed pa yin no //
analyzed: du ba'i bag chags ni grogs byed pa yin no //
translated: and the latent impression of smoke is the cooperative condition.

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa gcig la rag lus pas me las du ba skyes so zhes rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir go bar bya ba dang go bar byed par gnas @143a * //üîΩpa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa gcig la rag lus pas me las du ba skyes so zhes rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir go bar bya ba dang go bar byed par gnas @143a * // pa grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it depends on a single collection, it is established that smoke is produced from fire. Thus, the existence of the indicator and the indicated is established.

original: de bas na rnam par rig pa tsam nyid rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par rig pa tsam nyid rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that there is only representation.

original: 'o na gal te rnam par rig pa tsam yin na slob dpon gyis phyi rol gyi don la shes pa tshul gnyis pa can du ji ste ston te /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rnam par rig pa tsam yin na slob dpon gyis phyi rol gyi don la shes pa tshul gnyis pa can du ji ste ston te /

original: rnam par rig par smra bar rigs kyi /
analyzed: rnam par rig par smra bar rigs kyi /

original: don la brten par mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: don la brten par mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: but it is not tenable to rely on objects.

original: smras pa / mkhas rnams smra ba di dag yod //
analyzed: smras pa / mkhas rnams smra ba di dag yod //
