original: lhan cig nyams su myong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: lhan cig nyams su myong ba'i phyir //
translated: Because they are experienced together,

original: tshul gnyis de ni grub pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshul gnyis de ni grub pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: that twofold mode is established.

original: rnam par rig par smra ba de dag ni mkhas pa rnams la yod de /
analyzed: rnam par rig par smra ba de dag ni mkhas pa rnams la yod de /
translated: Those who speak of representation are wise.

original: phyi rol gyi don la brten pa ni phyir rol khas blangs nas blo tshul gnyis pa can du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don la brten pa ni phyir rol khas blangs nas blo tshul gnyis pa can du brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should speak of the twofold mode of mind in reliance on external objects, accepting external objects.

original: tshul gnyis pa can de yang phyi rol gyi don la grub pa yin te /üîΩlhan cig nyams su myong bar nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul gnyis pa can de yang phyi rol gyi don la grub pa yin te / lhan cig nyams su myong bar nges pa'i phyir /
translated: And that twofold mode is established with regard to external objects,üîΩbecause it is ascertained that they are experienced together.

original: lhan cig dmigs pa nges par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig dmigs pa nges par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is explained that they are ascertained to be simultaneously perceived.

original: myong bar nges pa ni tha dad pa dag la mi rung ngo zhes bstan to //
analyzed: myong bar nges pa ni tha dad pa dag la mi rung ngo zhes bstan to //
translated: It has been demonstrated that it is not possible for the ascertainment of experience to be different.

original: gal te shes pa rnam pa med pa yin na rtag tu dag pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te shes pa rnam pa med pa yin na rtag tu dag pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: If consciousness is without aspects, it would always be clear,üîΩand it would not have the nature of being clear, unclear, or middling, and so on.

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dang bar ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du ni ma yin pa las shes pa gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i bye brag snang ba yang yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dang bar ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du ni ma yin pa las shes pa gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i bye brag snang ba yang yin no //
translated: And yet the distinction of consciousness as clear or unclear appears.

original: 'di ltar / shes pa dbang po'i byed brag gis //
analyzed: 'di ltar / shes pa dbang po'i byed brag gis //
translated: Thus:

original: gsal dang mi gsal bar ma sogs //üîΩsnang ba tha dad don gcig la //
analyzed: gsal dang mi gsal bar ma sogs // snang ba tha dad don gcig la //
translated: Consciousness is clear or unclear, middling, and so on,üîΩdue to the distinction of the sense faculties.üîΩThe appearance of different things is seen

original: brten pa ru ni mthong ba yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩdbang por 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bye brag gi rgyus shes pa gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs par snang ba tha dad pa 'dzin pa don gcig la mthong ba yin na /
analyzed: brten pa ru ni mthong ba yin // zhes bya ba la / dbang por 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bye brag gi rgyus shes pa gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs par snang ba tha dad pa 'dzin pa don gcig la mthong ba yin na /
translated: to depend on a single object.üîΩDue to the cause of the distinction of the sense faculties, which are characterized as the agent, the appearance of consciousness as clear or unclear, and so on, is apprehended as different.

original: de ji ltar don gcig la shes pa rnam pa du ma can du 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar don gcig la shes pa rnam pa du ma can du 'gyur /
translated: If it is seen to depend on a single object, then how could a single object have many aspects for consciousness?

original: 'on kyang don nyid gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid can yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang don nyid gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid can yin gyi /
translated: But the object itself has a nature that is various, due to the distinctions of clarity, unclarity, and so on.

original: shes pa'i ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa'i ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not the case that consciousness is.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩIf consciousness arises from the object,

original: don las de der snang yin na //
analyzed: don las de der snang yin na //
translated: then it is the appearance of the object.

original: don tha dad med ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: don tha dad med ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: Because the object is not different,

original: de yi don can yid kun gyi //
analyzed: de yi don can yid kun gyi //
translated: the nature of all minds that have that object

original: ngo bo gcig pa nyid du 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngo bo gcig pa nyid du 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: would be the same.

original: gal te don las skyes pa'i shes pa de snang ba ste don gyi snang ba can yin na de'i tshe yid thams cad de'i don can de yul gcig pa can ngo bo gcig par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te don las skyes pa'i shes pa de snang ba ste don gyi snang ba can yin na de'i tshe yid thams cad de'i don can de yul gcig pa can ngo bo gcig par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If consciousness that arises from the object is the appearance, that is, has the appearance of the object, then at that time all minds that have that object, that is, that have the same object, would be the same nature.

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa sna tshogs snang bar ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa sna tshogs snang bar ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: They would not appear as various, such as clear or unclear,

original: phyi rol gyi don ngo bo gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don ngo bo gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of the external object is one.

original: sna tshogs @143b kyi rnam pa can ni skyes bu so so la gzhan dang gzhan gyi rnam pa dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs @143b kyi rnam pa can ni skyes bu so so la gzhan dang gzhan gyi rnam pa dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa nyid yin no //
translated: The consciousness that has various aspects is consciousness itself, because it is observed to have different aspects for different individuals.

original: 'on don gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa can du ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on don gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa can du ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: But how can consciousness that has the aspect of an object have various aspects?

original: don ngo bo nyid gcig ba'i phyir shes pa yang don gyi rnam pa gcig pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don ngo bo nyid gcig ba'i phyir shes pa yang don gyi rnam pa gcig pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the object has a single nature, consciousness also would have the aspect of a single object.

original: de'i phyir gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i bye brag med par mtshungs pa nyid yin no zhen /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i bye brag med par mtshungs pa nyid yin no zhen /
translated: Therefore, there would be no difference between clear and unclear cognitions.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /

analyzed: sngon dang dmar sogs snang ba dag / mig mi gsal bas mthong bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /

analyzed: rab rib la sogs pas nyams pa'i mig mi gsal ba'i skyes bus mar me'i rtse mor dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa sngon po dang dmar por snang ba dag dang / rma bya'i mdongs kyi rnam pa can mthong bar 'gyur ba de yang shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de / de bas na dbang po tha @144a * //

analyzed: 'on te 'od mar me las tha dad pa nyid yin no zhe na /

translated: Here, what is meaningful and what is not meaningful are not obscured.

original: gang gi phyir gsal ba dang mi gsal ba don dang don ma yin pa med pa ste nyams pa de lta bu ni gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i dngos po mthong bar ci ste byed de ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsal ba dang mi gsal ba don dang don ma yin pa med pa ste nyams pa de lta bu ni gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i dngos po mthong bar ci ste byed de ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Why is it that the seeing of things such as the manifest and the unmanifest is not like that, which is to say, that it is not impaired? The point is that it is not so.

original: 'on te gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i mthong ba skyed par byed na ni /
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i mthong ba skyed par byed na ni /
translated: But if the seeing of the manifest and the unmanifest is produced,

original: de lta na yang las kyi bag chags kyi stobs las gsal ba dang mi gsal ba skye ba'i phyir shes pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang las kyi bag chags kyi stobs las gsal ba dang mi gsal ba skye ba'i phyir shes pa nyid yin no //
translated: then in that case, because the manifest and the unmanifest arise by the power of the latent propensities of karma, it is consciousness.

original: nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir /üîΩde phyir don rten skyes gyur ba'i //
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir / de phyir don rten skyes gyur ba'i //
translated: To summarize,

original: myong ba ji lta'i rgyu bzhin du //
analyzed: myong ba ji lta'i rgyu bzhin du //
translated: therefore, the experience that arises in dependence on the object

original: snang ba tha dad 'jog par byed //
analyzed: snang ba tha dad 'jog par byed //
translated: is posited as the appearance of the variety of objectsüîΩin accordance with the cause.

original: lhag ma blong na rig pa dman //
analyzed: lhag ma blong na rig pa dman //
translated: If the rest are unclear, the mind is weak.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩrgyu ji lta ba bzhin du nyams su myong ba don la brten nas skyes par 'gyur ba ring ba nye ba tha dad pa dang dbang po tha dad pas gsal ba dang mi gsal bar snang ba tha dad par 'jog par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / rgyu ji lta ba bzhin du nyams su myong ba don la brten nas skyes par 'gyur ba ring ba nye ba tha dad pa dang dbang po tha dad pas gsal ba dang mi gsal bar snang ba tha dad par 'jog par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Here,

original: nyams su myong ba ni tshul gnyis pa @147a * //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ni tshul gnyis pa @147a * //
translated: experience is twofold: distant and near, and clear and unclear, because it is posited as different in terms of distance and nearness, and in terms of the clarity and unclarity of the different sense faculties, respectively, in accordance with the cause.

original: can no ; / lhag ma mar me la sogs pa'i bye brag gis gsal ba dang mi gsal bar rtog pa ni blo ngan pa can yin te rig pa dman pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: can no ; / lhag ma mar me la sogs pa'i bye brag gis gsal ba dang mi gsal bar rtog pa ni blo ngan pa can yin te rig pa dman pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The rest, the conceptions of clarity and unclarity through the distinctions of the lamp, etc., are of weak minds, because they are of inferior knowledge.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / shes pa sgra dang mar me dag / mngon sum mam ni cig shos kyi //
analyzed: gzhan yang / shes pa sgra dang mar me dag / mngon sum mam ni cig shos kyi //
translated: Knowledge of sound and the lamp is either direct perception or the other.

original: skyed byed nyid kyis snga ma yin //
analyzed: skyed byed nyid kyis snga ma yin //
translated: The former is the producer.

original: skad cig rnams ni 'jig pa'i phyir //
analyzed: skad cig rnams ni 'jig pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the moments are destroyed,

original: shes las med gsal gang gis shes //
analyzed: shes las med gsal gang gis shes //
translated: How does one know the clarity that is not knowledge?

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: shes pa dang sgra dang mar me de dag gal te skad cig ma yin pa de'i tshe shes pa la sogs pa skad cig mar gyur pa de rnams mngon sum gyi shes pa'am /
analyzed: shes pa dang sgra dang mar me de dag gal te skad cig ma yin pa de'i tshe shes pa la sogs pa skad cig mar gyur pa de rnams mngon sum gyi shes pa'am /
translated: If consciousness, sound, and the flame are momentary, then those consciousnesses, etc., which are momentary, would be the cause of the arising of a subsequent consciousness.

original: cig shos kyi shes pa skyed par byed pa yin pas shes pa skyed pa'i dus na zhig pa'i phyir med pa ni shes pa la gsal bar ji ltar shes te ma yin no //
analyzed: cig shos kyi shes pa skyed par byed pa yin pas shes pa skyed pa'i dus na zhig pa'i phyir med pa ni shes pa la gsal bar ji ltar shes te ma yin no //
translated: But since they cease at the time they produce consciousness, they do not exist. How could a nonexistent consciousness clearly cognize?

original: 'on te shes pa'i dus na gang yod pa'i don de rgyu min yang 'dzin par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa'i dus na gang yod pa'i don de rgyu min yang 'dzin par byed do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that at the time of consciousness, the object that exists is not its cause but is apprehended,

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: we reply:

original: phan 'dogs byed pa ma yin gzhan //üîΩgsal yin don kun gsal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: phan 'dogs byed pa ma yin gzhan // gsal yin don kun gsal bar 'gyur //
translated: It is not a benefit, but another.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩshes pa dang ngus mtshungs pa can du gyur pa shes pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa de ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / shes pa dang ngus mtshungs pa can du gyur pa shes pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa de ni /
translated: If it is clear, all objects would be clear.üîΩIf consciousness is not a benefit to consciousness,

original: shes pa la phan 'dogs pa byed pa las don gzhan gsal ba yin na ni /
analyzed: shes pa la phan 'dogs pa byed pa las don gzhan gsal ba yin na ni /
translated: it is another, clear object.

original: don thams cad gsal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don thams cad gsal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because all objects are illuminated, all are seen.

original: gal te de rgyus nges yin na //
analyzed: gal te de rgyus nges yin na //
translated: If it is determined by the cause,

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: this means

original: don thams cad du 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don thams cad du 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: that it does not grasp all objects.

original: shes pa dang don dag gi rgyu de las gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nges pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa dang don dag gi rgyu de las gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nges pa yin no //
translated: The determination of the grasped and grasper is from the cause of the cognition and the object.üîΩTherefore, the object is like the cognition that arises from the eye, since the grasped is determined by the object that is the cause of the cognition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes pa dang don dag gi ngo bo nyid mig las skyes pa'i shes pa de lta bu gang gis yul nges pa'i gzung ba 'dzin pas gzung ba yang de lta bu nyid de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes pa dang don dag gi ngo bo nyid mig las skyes pa'i shes pa de lta bu gang gis yul nges pa'i gzung ba 'dzin pas gzung ba yang de lta bu nyid de /
translated: The grasped is also like that, since the grasped is determined by the cognition.

original: gang gis shes pa nges pa'i gzung ba yin pa de ni rang gi rgyu las nges pa'i ngo bo nyid can no //
analyzed: gang gis shes pa nges pa'i gzung ba yin pa de ni rang gi rgyu las nges pa'i ngo bo nyid can no //
translated: That which is the grasped that determines the cognition has the nature of being determined from its own cause.

original: de'i phyir rang gi rgyu la nges pa'i ngo bo gzung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi rgyu la nges pa'i ngo bo gzung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the grasped is determined from its own cause.

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩshes la rtogs pa de yang med //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / shes la rtogs pa de yang med //
translated: That is not so.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: That realization of the cognition does not exist.

original: shes pa dang gzugs la sogs pa la rgyu nges pa can du rtogs kyang de dag 'dzin par rigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa dang gzugs la sogs pa la rgyu nges pa can du rtogs kyang de dag 'dzin par rigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Even if you realize that consciousness, form and so on have certain causes, it is illogical that they are apprehended.

original: 'di ltar rgyu nges pa'i dngos po rnams rang gi ngo bo nyid dam rgyu dang 'bras bu yin grang na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu nges pa'i dngos po rnams rang gi ngo bo nyid dam rgyu dang 'bras bu yin grang na /
translated: In this regard, do things with certain causes exist by their own intrinsic reality or are they causes and effects?

original: de la re zhig shes pa dang don dag rang gi ngo bo nyid la rgyu nges pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig shes pa dang don dag rang gi ngo bo nyid la rgyu nges pa ni ma yin te /
translated: First, consciousness and objects do not have certain causes in their intrinsic reality.

original: gang dus mtshungs par snang ba de rang gi ngo bo nyid la rgyur nges pa yin na ni don dang shes pa dag snang du rung ba'i ngo bo nyid du shes par 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: gang dus mtshungs par snang ba de rang gi ngo bo nyid la rgyur nges pa yin na ni don dang shes pa dag snang du rung ba'i ngo bo nyid du shes par 'gyur ba na /
translated: If that which appears at the same time is ascertained as a cause in its intrinsic reality, then consciousness would be ascertained as the intrinsic reality of objects that are suitable to appear.

original: sngon @147b po dang shes pa dag sngon gyi rgyu la ltos nas rang gi ngo bo nyid du snang ba thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sngon @147b po dang shes pa dag sngon gyi rgyu la ltos nas rang gi ngo bo nyid du snang ba thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: But prior to consciousness and objects, their appearance is obtained in dependence on their causes.

original: phan tshun rag las pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phan tshun rag las pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: They are not mutually dependent.

original: phan tshun du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po ma yin te /
translated: They are not mutually apprehended objects and apprehending subjects.

original: dus mtshungs par skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus mtshungs par skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they arise at the same time.

original: gang la ltos nas shes pa dang don dag gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa de nyid rang gi rgyu las gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i 'brel pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang la ltos nas shes pa dang don dag gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa de nyid rang gi rgyu las gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i 'brel pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: If consciousness and objects existed as the nature of clarity, they would be related as the apprehended object and apprehending subject in dependence on their causes.

original: nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo nyid las gzhan pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo nyid las gzhan pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The apprehended object and apprehending subject do not exist apart from the nature of experience.

original: don dang shes pa dag nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo nyid kyang rgyu yis byas pa yin pa de bas na gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid rang gi rgyu kho na las skyes pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ma yin no //
analyzed: don dang shes pa dag nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo nyid kyang rgyu yis byas pa yin pa de bas na gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid rang gi rgyu kho na las skyes pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ma yin no //
translated: Since the nature of experience of objects and consciousness is also produced by causes, the nature of clarity is not the apprehended object and apprehending subject because it arises from its own causes alone.

original: 'on te rgyu dang 'bras bu la rang gi rgyu nges pa yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu dang 'bras bu la rang gi rgyu nges pa yin na ni /
translated: But if the cause and effect are ascertained as its own cause,

original: de lta yang shes pa dang don dag 'bras bu nges par bskyed pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yang shes pa dang don dag 'bras bu nges par bskyed pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: then in that case, since consciousness and objects are ascertained as the effect produced, how could they be the entity of the apprehended object and apprehending subject?

original: shes pa dang don dag phan 'dogs pa'i dngos por 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: shes pa dang don dag phan 'dogs pa'i dngos por 'gyur gyi /
translated: Consciousness and objects would be the entity that benefits each other.

original: de tsam gyis gzung ba 'dzin pa'i dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis gzung ba 'dzin pa'i dngos po ma yin no //
translated: But that alone does not make it an entity of subject and object.

original: de'i phyir don dang shes pa dag tu dus mtshungs pa sngar gyi rgyu las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dang shes pa dag tu dus mtshungs pa sngar gyi rgyu las skyes pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the object and consciousness are simultaneous, arising from a previous cause,

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid snang ba can gyi rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid snang ba can gyi rtogs pa yin no //
translated: and the cognition has the appearance of its own nature.

original: 'o na gal te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po ma yin na shes pa don gyi gsal byed du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po ma yin na shes pa don gyi gsal byed du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is not an entity of subject and object, how can consciousness be the illuminator of the object?

original: de tshe med kyang des byas pas ;
analyzed: de tshe med kyang des byas pas ;
translated: Even though it does not exist at that time, it is said to be the illuminator

original: / don snang phyir na shes pa ni //üîΩde yis gsal bar byed pa brjod //üîΩces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: / don snang phyir na shes pa ni // de yis gsal bar byed pa brjod // ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the object appears to it.

original: don de shes pa'i dus su med par 'gyur kyang /
analyzed: don de shes pa'i dus su med par 'gyur kyang /
translated: Even though the object does not exist at the time of the consciousness,

original: don des shes pa skyed par byas pa'i phyir shes pa don gyi rnam pa snang bas don de gsal ba yin zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: don des shes pa skyed par byas pa'i phyir shes pa don gyi rnam pa snang bas don de gsal ba yin zhes brjod kyi /
translated: it is said that the object is illuminated by that consciousness because the object generates the consciousness and the object appears in the aspect of the object to the consciousness.

original: don nyid ngo bo nyid kyis nyams su myong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don nyid ngo bo nyid kyis nyams su myong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But the object is not experienced by its own nature.

original: de bas na de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa nyid rang rig pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa nyid rang rig pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, consciousness itself, which has the aspect of that, is reflexive awareness.

original: 'o na gal te de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa nyams su myong ba na don snga ma dus mtshungs pa can nyams su myong ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa nyams su myong ba na don snga ma dus mtshungs pa can nyams su myong ba yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhen the experience of consciousness that has the aspect of that is experienced, is the object of the past experienced?‚Äù

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i don gzhan ni //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i don gzhan ni //
translated: Since another object that is coemergent

original: mi phan phyir rnam mi 'jog pas //
analyzed: mi phan phyir rnam mi 'jog pas //
translated: is not posited as an aspect because it is not helpful,

original: shes la rnam pa ma bzhag pa //
analyzed: shes la rnam pa ma bzhag pa //
translated: the aspect is not posited in consciousness.

original: rang dngos gsal bar ji ltar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang dngos gsal bar ji ltar 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: How could the object itself be clear?

original: skyed par byed pa'i don las gzhan pa'i don ni shes pa don dus mtshungs pa can te /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i don las gzhan pa'i don ni shes pa don dus mtshungs pa can te /
translated: The object that is different from the object that generates it is the object that is simultaneous with consciousness.

original: de phan 'dogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa mi 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: de phan 'dogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa mi 'jog pa ste /
translated: Since it is not helpful, it is not posited as an aspect.

original: rnam pa can du skyed par mi byed kyi gang gi phyir @148a * //
analyzed: rnam pa can du skyed par mi byed kyi gang gi phyir @148a * //
translated: It does not generate an aspect.

original: shes pa nyid dang lhan cig nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo nyid du skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa nyid dang lhan cig nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo nyid du skyes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is born as the nature that is experienced simultaneously with consciousness itself.

original: bdag nyid kyi rnam pa shes pa la 'jog na ni gsal bar rung gi rnam pa mi 'jog na ni rang gi don gyi rnam pa ji ltar gsal bar 'gyur te ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi rnam pa shes pa la 'jog na ni gsal bar rung gi rnam pa mi 'jog na ni rang gi don gyi rnam pa ji ltar gsal bar 'gyur te ma yin no //
translated: If the aspect of the object is posited as the cognition, then it is suitable that it is clear. But if the aspect is not posited, how could the object‚Äôs aspect be clear? It could not be!

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i don gyi bdag nyid rang gi ngo bo nyid rang gis ma rtogs kyang de'i rnam pa can du shes pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir gsal bar brjod kyi /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i don gyi bdag nyid rang gi ngo bo nyid rang gis ma rtogs kyang de'i rnam pa can du shes pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir gsal bar brjod kyi /
translated: Even though the nature of a hidden object is not itself realized, it is said to be clear because the cognition that has its aspect is experienced.

original: don gyi ngo bo nyid kyis snang na ni rang gi rgyu'i stobs las skyes pa'i don mtshungs pa can gyi shes pa dang 'brel pa ci yang med pa'i phyir 'di ni gzung bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo nyid kyis snang na ni rang gi rgyu'i stobs las skyes pa'i don mtshungs pa can gyi shes pa dang 'brel pa ci yang med pa'i phyir 'di ni gzung bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: If the object‚Äôs nature itself appeared, it would not be apprehended, because it would have no connection with a cognition that has a similar object, which arises by the power of its own cause.

original: shes pa la sogs pa rnams shes pa'i dus na med pas don nyid rig pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: shes pa la sogs pa rnams shes pa'i dus na med pas don nyid rig pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Since cognitions such as visual cognition do not exist at the time of the object, the object is not aware of itself.

original: de'i stobs kyis de'i rnam pa can gyi rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis de'i rnam pa can gyi rtogs pa ste /
translated: However, by the power of the object, there is a realization that has its aspect.

original: gang yang brtan par gnas pa'i rdo rje'i rdo ba la sogs pa'i don shes pa'i dus na yod kyang de'i rang gi ngo bo rig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang yang brtan par gnas pa'i rdo rje'i rdo ba la sogs pa'i don shes pa'i dus na yod kyang de'i rang gi ngo bo rig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But when the meaning of a stable thing such as a diamond or a rock is cognized, it is the nature of that object that is cognized.

original: rdo rje'i rdo la sogs pa'i don //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rdo la sogs pa'i don //
translated: The meaning of a diamond or a rock

original: brtan des gzhan la ltos med phyir //
analyzed: brtan des gzhan la ltos med phyir //
translated: is stable, because it is independent of another.

original: 'gro ba kun gyi shes pa ni //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun gyi shes pa ni //
translated: The consciousness of all transmigrators

original: cig car rang nyid skye bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: cig car rang nyid skye bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: would arise simultaneously by itself.

original: rdo rje'i rdo ba la sogs pa gang yin pa'i brtan pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i rdo ba la sogs pa gang yin pa'i brtan pa ste /
translated: The meaning of a diamond or a rock is stable, that is, permanent.

original: rtag pa'i don de yang 'gro ba thams cad kyi shes pa cig car te bdag nyid kyis skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtag pa'i don de yang 'gro ba thams cad kyi shes pa cig car te bdag nyid kyis skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The consciousness of all transmigrators would arise simultaneously, by itself,

original: lhan cig byed pa gzhan la rag ma lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa gzhan la rag ma lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not depend on another cooperative condition.

original: dus yun ring por gnas pa la rtag pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dus yun ring por gnas pa la rtag pa zhes brjod do //
translated: That which endures for a long time is called permanent.

original: gal te yang don dus yun ring por gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na de'i tshe dang po mthong ba na dus thams cad na gnas pa'i don kun yongs su rdzogs pa ma mthong ba'i phyir rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang don dus yun ring por gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na de'i tshe dang po mthong ba na dus thams cad na gnas pa'i don kun yongs su rdzogs pa ma mthong ba'i phyir rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the object is by nature something that endures for a long time, then when it is first seen, it is not seen as an object that endures for a long time, because it is not complete.

original: de nyid kyi tshe yongs su ma rdzogs pa la rtag pa zhes brjod par ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe yongs su ma rdzogs pa la rtag pa zhes brjod par ni mi rung ngo //
translated: And it is not tenable to call it ‚Äúenduring‚Äù when it is incomplete.

original: dus thams cad ma mthong na ni dus ring por rtog pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: dus thams cad ma mthong na ni dus ring por rtog pa can ma yin no //
translated: If it is not seen at all times, then it is not imagined to endure for a long time.

original: 'on te dus kyi cha rim gyis 'byung ba yin pas rim pa med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dus kyi cha rim gyis 'byung ba yin pas rim pa med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if it is a part of time that occurs in sequence, how can it be without sequence?

original: 'on ni dus thams cad la khyab par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on ni dus thams cad la khyab par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not known to pervade all times.

original: de bas na don gang zhig dus yun ring por gnas pa de kho na bzhin du cig car mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na don gang zhig dus yun ring por gnas pa de kho na bzhin du cig car mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, whatever object endures for a long time is seen all at once, just as it is.

original: 'o na mig la sogs pa'i rgyu la ltos nas shes pa gzhan dang gzhan du bskyed pas rim pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mig la sogs pa'i rgyu la ltos nas shes pa gzhan dang gzhan du bskyed pas rim pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is a cause of visual cognition, it produces cognition in sequence, so it is sequential.

original: de la smras pa /

translated: It is not contradictory to the apprehender.üîΩIf the thought ‚ÄúI am‚Äù arose from self-awareness of the form of the body and so on,

analyzed: de bzhin du rtsig pa la sogs pa la yang rang rig pa las nga'i rtsig pa'o snyam pa'i rtog pa skye bar gyur pa zhig na /
translated: then in the same way, the thought ‚ÄúMy wall‚Äù would arise from self-awareness of a wall and so on.

original: rtsig pa la sogs pa la de ltar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pa la de ltar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But that is not so with respect to walls, etc.

original: de bas na rtsig pa la sogs pa la rang rig pa nyid med do zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na rtsig pa la sogs pa la rang rig pa nyid med do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, there is no self-awareness with respect to walls, etc.

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: ji ltar shes pas gzhan gzung bar bya ba yin yang rtsig pa la sogs pa la nga'o snyam pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar shes pas gzhan gzung bar bya ba yin yang rtsig pa la sogs pa la nga'o snyam pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Even though consciousness is apprehended by another, it is not the case that there is the thought ‚ÄúI am‚Äù with respect to walls, etc.

original: 'on kyang lus kho na la nga'o snyam du sems so //
analyzed: 'on kyang lus kho na la nga'o snyam du sems so //
translated: But rather, there is the thought ‚ÄúI am‚Äù with respect to the body alone.

original: de bzhin du rang rig par mtshungs kyang rtsig pa la sogs pa la bdag tu 'dzin pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang rig par mtshungs kyang rtsig pa la sogs pa la bdag tu 'dzin pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, even though there is self-awareness, it is not the case that there is the apprehension of a self with respect to walls, etc.

original: 'on kyang lus kho na la yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang lus kho na la yin no //
translated: But rather, there is the apprehension of a self with respect to the body alone.

original: 'on te lus la nga'o snyam du rtog pa ni nye bar brtags pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te lus la nga'o snyam du rtog pa ni nye bar brtags pa ste /
translated: But if the thought ‚ÄúI am‚Äù with respect to the body is a mere imputation,

original: bdag lus can ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag lus can ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: then the self does not have a body, because the self is not a substance.

original: bdag de yongs su mi gcod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag de yongs su mi gcod pa'i phyir te /
translated: No, because the self is not differentiated.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i shes pa ni lus nyid rig pa la sogs pa dang ldan par rtag tu snang gi / ma 'khrul pa'i rtogs pas shes par gyur pa la nye bar btags pa zhes ni mi bya'o zhes brjod do //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i shes pa ni lus nyid rig pa la sogs pa dang ldan par rtag tu snang gi / ma 'khrul pa'i rtogs pas shes par gyur pa la nye bar btags pa zhes ni mi bya'o zhes brjod do //
translated: The cognition ‚ÄúI am‚Äù always appears as if it were aware of the body, etc.,üîΩand it is not called ‚Äúa designation based on the realization of non-error.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang lus la sogs pa ma gtogs pa'i 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang lus la sogs pa ma gtogs pa'i 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the cognition ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is not a cognition of something other than the body, etc.

original: 'on kyang gzung ba'i ngo bo nyid can mig la sogs par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzung ba'i ngo bo nyid can mig la sogs par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: but rather it is a cognition of the eye, etc., which have the nature of the grasped.

original: 'on te bde ba la sogs pas sngon po la sogs pa rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa nyid yin no //üîΩbdag tu rtog pa'i rgyu ni brtan pa dang 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te bde ba la sogs pas sngon po la sogs pa rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa nyid yin no // bdag tu rtog pa'i rgyu ni brtan pa dang 'brel ba ste /
translated: Or, if pleasure, etc., are not aware of blue, etc., then they are self-aware.üîΩThe cause of the conception of self is the connection with the body.

original: brtan pa dang 'brel pa ni lus nyid kyis yin gyi /
analyzed: brtan pa dang 'brel pa ni lus nyid kyis yin gyi /
translated: The connection with the body is the cause of the conception of self,

original: rtsig pa la sogs pa la bdag tu rtog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pa la bdag tu rtog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but the conception of self does not occur in regard to walls, etc.

original: gzhan yang nga'o snyam pa'i shes pa ni bdag la dmigs pa'i shes pa gzhan kho na ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang nga'o snyam pa'i shes pa ni bdag la dmigs pa'i shes pa gzhan kho na ste /
translated: Moreover, the cognition ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is a cognition that has as its object the self.

original: 'di yin no snyam du mdun na gnas pa'i dngos po la 'jug pa'i shes pa yang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: 'di yin no snyam du mdun na gnas pa'i dngos po la 'jug pa'i shes pa yang gzhan yin no //
translated: The consciousness that engages the object that is present in front of one, thinking ‚ÄúThis is it,‚Äù is also different.

original: de ji ltar phan tshun du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar phan tshun du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por shes par 'gyur /
translated: How could they be mutually known as the things that are the apprehended object and the apprehending subject?

original: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis nyams su myong bas rang rig pa'o zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis nyams su myong bas rang rig pa'o zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is established that it is reflexive awareness because it is experienced by its own nature.

original: 'o na gal te gzugs la sogs pa ma rtogs pa'i blo med pa de lta na yang rang rig pa ma yin te gzugs la sogs pa'i blo la de'i rnam pa can gyi tha dad pa'i phyis rig pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te gzugs la sogs pa ma rtogs pa'i blo med pa de lta na yang rang rig pa ma yin te gzugs la sogs pa'i blo la de'i rnam pa can gyi tha dad pa'i phyis rig pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But if there is no cognition of form and so on, then even if it is not reflexive awareness, it is a cognition of form and so on because it is a later cognition that has its aspect.

original: smras pa / de'i dngos can gyi blo yis ni //
analyzed: smras pa / de'i dngos can gyi blo yis ni //
translated: In response, it is said:üîΩHow could a cognition that has that as its object

original: shes pa 'gags pa ji ltar myong //
analyzed: shes pa 'gags pa ji ltar myong //
translated: experience a cognition that has ceased?

original: des rang ngo bo myong med phyir //
analyzed: des rang ngo bo myong med phyir //
translated: Because it does not experience its own nature,

original: nyams myong ma lus @150b 'chad par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyams myong ma lus @150b 'chad par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: all experience is refuted.

original: dus phyis 'byung ba'i blos blo snga ma'i rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: dus phyis 'byung ba'i blos blo snga ma'i rang bzhin nam /
translated: A later cognition does not have the nature of an earlier cognition.

original: rnam pa med par don gyis go ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos /
analyzed: rnam pa med par don gyis go ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos /
translated: And so on refers to the understanding of objects without aspects and so on.

original: shes pas shes pa 'dzin pa na /
analyzed: shes pas shes pa 'dzin pa na /
translated: When consciousness apprehends consciousness,

original: shes pa snga ma 'gags pa de ni skad cig ma ste /
analyzed: shes pa snga ma 'gags pa de ni skad cig ma ste /
translated: the previous moment of consciousness that has ceased is momentary.

original: blo gzhan gyi dus na med par khas len pa'i phyir nyams su myong bar ji ltar 'gyur te ma yin no //
analyzed: blo gzhan gyi dus na med par khas len pa'i phyir nyams su myong bar ji ltar 'gyur te ma yin no //
translated: Since it is accepted that it does not exist at the time of the other mind, how could it be experienced? It could not be.

original: blo phyi ma de bdag gi ngo bo myong bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: blo phyi ma de bdag gi ngo bo myong bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: The later mind does not experience the entity of the former mind.

original: sngar gyi shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo rig pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar gyi shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo rig pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: And the former consciousness would not cognize its own entity.

original: nyams su myong ba ma lus pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ma lus pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus all experience would be averted.

original: gzhan yang / don du snang ba dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang / don du snang ba dang ldan pa /
translated: Moreover,üîΩConsciousness endowed with the appearance of objects

original: shes te phyi rol mngon phyogs dang // blo la 'dzin par byed pa'i blo //
analyzed: shes te phyi rol mngon phyogs dang // blo la 'dzin par byed pa'i blo //
translated: is said to engage external objects.üîΩThe mind that apprehends objects

original: rtag tu bdag la nang mngon phyogs //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtag tu bdag la nang mngon phyogs // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: always faces inward.

original: don snang ba dang ldan pa'i shes pa yul la 'jug par 'gyur ba ni phyi rol du mngon du phyogs par snang ba can te /
analyzed: don snang ba dang ldan pa'i shes pa yul la 'jug par 'gyur ba ni phyi rol du mngon du phyogs par snang ba can te /
translated: This verse shows that consciousness endowed with the appearance of objects engages with objects and appears to face external objects.

original: shes pa tha dad pas rig pa phyi rol pa ma yin pa'i dngos por shes par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa tha dad pas rig pa phyi rol pa ma yin pa'i dngos por shes par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because consciousness is different, it is not possible to know that awareness is an external thing.

original: de bzhin du blo la 'dzin par byed pa'i blo yang phyi rol du phyogs pa'i snang ba can du 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du blo la 'dzin par byed pa'i blo yang phyi rol du phyogs pa'i snang ba can du 'gyur na /
translated: In the same way, if the awareness that apprehends were to appear externally,

original: gang gi phyir nyams su myong ba'i blo la 'dzin par byed pa'i blo rig pa gang yin pa'i blo de ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyams su myong ba'i blo la 'dzin par byed pa'i blo rig pa gang yin pa'i blo de ni /
translated: then the awareness that is aware of the awareness that apprehends the experience

original: rtag tu nang du bltas pas rtag tu nang nyid yin pas bdag nyid rtogs par byas par snang ba yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu nang du bltas pas rtag tu nang nyid yin pas bdag nyid rtogs par byas par snang ba yin no //
translated: would always be directed internally, and so it would appear to realize itself.

original: de'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi blo rig pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi blo rig pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the awareness of all sentient beings would be aware of itself.

original: 'on te rang gi yin pas blo nang du bltas te snang ba yin la /
analyzed: 'on te rang gi yin pas blo nang du bltas te snang ba yin la /
translated: But if it is your own awareness that is directed internally and appears,

original: gzugs la sogs pa de dag phyi rol pa yin pas nang du bltas te snang ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de dag phyi rol pa yin pas nang du bltas te snang ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then form and so on are external and do not appear internally.

original: de lta na dran pas gang gi tshe bdag gi blo 'dzin na de'i tshe phyi rol du snang ba can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na dran pas gang gi tshe bdag gi blo 'dzin na de'i tshe phyi rol du snang ba can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, when the mind is held by memory, it does not appear as external.

original: 'on te blo dran bzhin pa dus kyi bye brag gis dran pa las tha dad pas phyi rol du snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te blo dran bzhin pa dus kyi bye brag gis dran pa las tha dad pas phyi rol du snang ngo zhe na /
translated: But if the mind that is remembered is different from the memory due to a difference in time, it appears as external.

original: 'on ni shes pa tha dad pa'i gzung ba'i blo rang gi ngo bo tha dad pas tha dad par snang ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'on ni shes pa tha dad pa'i gzung ba'i blo rang gi ngo bo tha dad pas tha dad par snang ba nyid de /
translated: But the mind that is the object of a different consciousness appears as different due to the difference in its own nature.

original: bdag gis nyams su myong ba las tha dad pa'i blo gsal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis nyams su myong ba las tha dad pa'i blo gsal ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the mind is clear as something different from what is experienced by oneself.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nang du nyams su myong bar gyur pa'i blo ni rang rig pa'i ngo bo kho na yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nang du nyams su myong bar gyur pa'i blo ni rang rig pa'i ngo bo kho na yin no //
translated: For that very reason, the mind that is experienced internally is the nature of reflexive awareness.üîΩMoreover:

original: gzhan yang / gang zhig gang gi yul du snang //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gang zhig gang gi yul du snang //
translated: That which appears as the object of what

original: de des myong ba min thob 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de des myong ba min thob 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is not obtained by the experience of that.

original: shes pa gang zhig dang 'brel pa can gyi yul du snang ba gang yin pa'i yul de ni /
analyzed: shes pa gang zhig dang 'brel pa can gyi yul du snang ba gang yin pa'i yul de ni /
translated: Here, the object that appears as the object of what is related to consciousnessüîΩis not obtained by the experience of that consciousness.

original: shes pa des myong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes pa des myong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not experienced by that consciousness‚Äù is what is obtained.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i don snang ba nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩrang rig pa yin na ni yul gyi rnam pa nyams su myong na don @151a * //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i don snang ba nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro // rang rig pa yin na ni yul gyi rnam pa nyams su myong na don @151a * //
translated: Because the object that is its own nature does not appear and is not experienced.

original: myong ngo zhes brjod par rigs so //üîΩgal te de 'dra las myong ba //
analyzed: myong ngo zhes brjod par rigs so // gal te de 'dra las myong ba //
translated: If it were reflexive awareness, it would be reasonable to say that the aspect of the object is experienced and the object is experienced.

original: gzhan yod ces ni 'dod ce na //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yod ces ni 'dod ce na // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you assert that experience is different from that,

original: 'on te yul dang 'dra ba las myong ba gzhan gang zhig yod de /üîΩmed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on te yul dang 'dra ba las myong ba gzhan gang zhig yod de / med pa kho na'o //
translated: then how could it be the experience of that object?üîΩIf you say, ‚ÄúThe experience is different from the object, but it is not nonexistent.

original: de'i phyir don dang 'dra ba nyid la gzugs la sogs pa myong ba'o zhes brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dang 'dra ba nyid la gzugs la sogs pa myong ba'o zhes brjod do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the experience of form and so on is just like the object,‚Äù

original: gal te de lta bur gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te de lta bur gyur na ni /
translated: then if that were the case,

original: 'dra bas thams cad phan tshun dag / myong ba nyid du thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dra bas thams cad phan tshun dag / myong ba nyid du thob par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: all things would be mutually experienced by their similarities.

original: don rnams la 'dra ba yod pas don de dag phan tshun myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don rnams la 'dra ba yod pas don de dag phan tshun myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the similarities of objects exist, those objects would be mutually experienced.

original: 'on te don yin pa'i phyir 'dra ba yod kyang don la ni don gzhan gyis rig par 'gyur ba'i thal ba med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te don yin pa'i phyir 'dra ba yod kyang don la ni don gzhan gyis rig par 'gyur ba'i thal ba med do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that although there is a similarity because of the object, there is no entailment that the object is cognized by another object,

original: 'dir don zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin //
analyzed: 'dir don zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin //
translated: then what is this so-called object?

original: glo ma yin pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: glo ma yin pa'o zhe na /
translated: If you say it is not the mind,

original: blo nyid kyang don nyid kyis grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: blo nyid kyang don nyid kyis grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: isn‚Äôt the mind itself established by the object?

original: de ma grub par yang gnyi ga la grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ma grub par yang gnyi ga la grub pa yin no //
translated: Even if it is not established, both are established.

original: de bas na rang rig pa nyid la blo nyid ces bya ba 'di rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na rang rig pa nyid la blo nyid ces bya ba 'di rigs so //
translated: Therefore it is reasonable to say that the mind itself is reflexive awareness.

original: de 'dra'i blo de myong zhe na //
analyzed: de 'dra'i blo de myong zhe na //
translated: If you say that mind experiences such an object,

original: zhes bya ba ni /üîΩde ni 'dod mod kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni / de ni 'dod mod kyang /
translated: this is what we assert.

original: 'dra ba tsam gyi don nyams su myong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dra ba tsam gyi don nyams su myong ba ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the experience of an object that is similar to it.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: blo don gyi dran pa can ni don rnams rig pa'o //
analyzed: blo don gyi dran pa can ni don rnams rig pa'o //
translated: The memory of the object that exists in the mind is the cognition of the object.

original: de'i phyir blo la gnas pa'i 'dra bas don myong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir blo la gnas pa'i 'dra bas don myong ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore the experience of the object is by means of a similarity that exists in the mind.

original: blo tsam mam 'dra ba tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: blo tsam mam 'dra ba tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not by means of the mind alone or by means of a mere similarity.

original: blo tsam myong ba yin na rig pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: blo tsam myong ba yin na rig pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the experience were of the mind alone, it would be reflexive awareness.

original: don rig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don rig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be the cognition of the object.

original: 'dra ba tsam gyis myong ba yin na don rnams kyang phan tshun rig par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'dra ba tsam gyis myong ba yin na don rnams kyang phan tshun rig par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is the experience of mere similarity, then objects would also be mutually cognized.

original: da ni rig pa 'dra bdag nyid //
analyzed: da ni rig pa 'dra bdag nyid //
translated: Now, the similarity is the nature of cognition.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: This is what is said.

original: da ni blo la gnas pa'i 'dra ba khas len na /
analyzed: da ni blo la gnas pa'i 'dra ba khas len na /
translated: Now, if the similarity that exists in the mind is accepted,

original: don rnams 'dra bas rig par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: don rnams 'dra bas rig par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: objects are not cognized by similarity.

original: 'on kyang shes par rang rig ba'i rang bzhin gyis don myong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang shes par rang rig ba'i rang bzhin gyis don myong ba yin no //
translated: However, the object is experienced by the nature of self-awareness that cognizes itself.

original: de lta ma yin na don dang shes pa dag bye brag mod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na don dang shes pa dag bye brag mod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, there would be no difference between the object and cognition.

original: 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir shes pa don las tha dad pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir shes pa don las tha dad pa'o zhe na /
translated: It is said that cognition is different from the object because it is the apprehender.

original: ma yin te de nyid 'dzin par byed pa ste gzugs la sogs pa yang 'dra bas 'dzin par byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te de nyid 'dzin par byed pa ste gzugs la sogs pa yang 'dra bas 'dzin par byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because that very [cognition] is the apprehender. Even forms and so forth are apprehended by similarity.

original: 'on te gzugs la sogs pa dag 'dzin par byed pa ma yin na ni //
analyzed: 'on te gzugs la sogs pa dag 'dzin par byed pa ma yin na ni //
translated: But if forms and so forth are not the apprehender,

original: 'o na 'dzin par byed pa grub na ni 'ga' zhig 'dzin pa ma yin par grub pa ma yin nas /
analyzed: 'o na 'dzin par byed pa grub na ni 'ga' zhig 'dzin pa ma yin par grub pa ma yin nas /
translated: then if the apprehender is established, it is not established that anything is not apprehended.

original: 'dzin par byed pa de nyid da dung brtan pa grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa de nyid da dung brtan pa grub pa ma yin no //
translated: The apprehension of that is not yet established as firm.

original: de bas na rang rig pa nyid khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rang rig pa nyid khyad par yin no //
translated: Therefore, self-awareness is the distinctive feature.

original: 'on te blo'i nyams su myong ba ni 'dra ba'i rgyu can te /
analyzed: 'on te blo'i nyams su myong ba ni 'dra ba'i rgyu can te /
translated: But if the experience of awareness has a similar cause,

original: nyams su myong ba'i phyir don nyams su myong ba bzhin no zhe na de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i phyir don nyams su myong ba bzhin no zhe na de ni ma yin te /
translated: like the experience of an object, because it is experienced, that is not so.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: nyams su myong ba de rang nyid //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba de rang nyid //
translated: That experience itself

original: de de 'dra ba'i rgyu can min //üîΩ@151b bya ba las kyi rnam gzhag gi //
analyzed: de de 'dra ba'i rgyu can min // @151b bya ba las kyi rnam gzhag gi //
translated: does not have a similar cause.üîΩIn the world, it is the cause

original: de ni 'jig rten na rgyur 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten na rgyur 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: of the presentation of the activity of the object.

original: blo de rang nyid kyis nyams su myong ba ste 'on kyang 'dra ba'i rgyu can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: blo de rang nyid kyis nyams su myong ba ste 'on kyang 'dra ba'i rgyu can ni ma yin no //

original: de yang med do //
analyzed: de yang med do //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /

analyzed: ma grub na ni rtags nyid min //

analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
